这是一个较少见、偏书面/学术的词。在一般日常英语里，更常用 clump, cluster, gather, lump, accumulation 等表达相近意思。
修辞义（把论据“堆起来”）在现代英语写作课或修辞学语境中更可能见到。

summary.en: “Conglobe” means to gather into one mass or form into a ball/globe; it’s rare and literary.
summary.zh: “Conglobe”表示“聚合成一体、聚成球/团”，较罕见且偏书面/文学用法。

definition.en: to gather or combine things into a single mass; to form into a ball or globe (often used in a scientific or literary style)
definition.zh: 把事物聚合成一体；使聚成球状/团状（常见于科学或文学语境，较少用）

examples.en: Dust and ice can conglobe in space and gradually become a small planet.
examples.zh: 尘埃和冰在太空中可能会聚合，逐渐形成一颗小行星。

examples.en: In the cold, the melted wax began to conglobe into a smooth lump.
examples.zh: 在低温下，融化的蜡开始凝结聚成一个光滑的蜡团。

extraExplanation: “Conglobe”非常罕见，带有书面/古典色彩，来源于 con-（共同、聚合）+ globe（球体）。现代英语更常用的表达是 “gather together / clump together / form into a ball / coalesce”。

summary.en: Conglobed means gathered into a rounded mass or tightly clustered together (a literary word).
summary.zh: conglobed 指“聚成一团/球状”的（偏文学用语）。

definition.en: (Literary) Gathered or formed into a rounded mass; clustered together like a ball.
definition.zh: （文学用语）聚成一团的；形成球状/团块的；紧密聚集的。

examples.en: Mist hung over the river in conglobed patches.
examples.zh: 雾气在河面上成团成片地凝结着。

examples.en: The bees formed a conglobed cluster around the queen.
examples.zh: 蜜蜂围着蜂王聚成一团。

examples.en: At the top of the hill, clouds looked conglobed and heavy.
examples.zh: 在山顶，云看起来团团堆积，沉沉压着。

extraExplanation: “conglobed”比较少见，多见于文学或较正式的描写；它是动词“conglobe”（使成球状、使聚成一团）的过去分词作形容词使用。
词根与“globe（地球；球体）”同源，来自拉丁语 globus（球、团）。用它可以强调“像球一样聚拢成块”的视觉感。

summary.en: Conglobe means to form or gather into a round mass; it can also mean a round mass itself (rare).
summary.zh: Conglobe 指（使）聚成球状/团块；也可指球状团块本身（较少见）。

definition.en: to gather or form into a round mass; to make something into a ball or globe (often used in literary or scientific writing).
definition.zh: （使）聚成一团；（使）形成球状/团块（多见于文学或较旧的科学文体）。

examples.en: Clouds conglobed into a dark mass over the hills.
examples.zh: 云层在山丘上方聚成一大片乌云。

examples.en: The dust conglobed into small clumps after the rain.
examples.zh: 下雨后，灰尘结成了小团块。

examples.en: Heat can make droplets conglobe into larger beads.
examples.zh: 热量会使小液滴聚合成更大的水珠。

definition.en: a round mass or cluster; something shaped like a ball (rare).
definition.zh: 球状团块；圆形聚集体（少见）。

examples.en: A conglobe of mist sat low on the water.
examples.zh: 一团雾气低低地停在水面上。

examples.en: They watched a conglobe of insects swirl under the lamp.
examples.zh: 他们看着灯下聚成一团的昆虫盘旋。

extraExplanation: “conglobes”通常是动词第三人称单数（He/She/It conglobes...）或名词复数（conglobes）。更常见的现代替换说法有：gather into a ball, clump together, form a mass。
词源上可理解为 con-（一起）+ globe（球体），因此核心画面就是“聚到一起变成球/团”。

summary.en: “Conglobing” means clumping or gathering into a round mass (a rare, formal word).
summary.zh: “conglobing”指“聚成球状/结成团块”，是较罕用、偏正式的说法。

definition.en: (rare) Forming into a round mass; gathering or clumping together into a ball-like shape.
definition.zh: （罕用）把……聚成球状；使……结成团块。

examples.en: The dust was conglobing into small balls under the damp air.
examples.zh: 在潮湿的空气里，灰尘正在结成一个个小团球。

examples.en: Heat can make fat conglobing on the surface of the soup.
examples.zh: 加热会让油脂在汤面上凝结成团。

extraExplanation: “conglobing”通常是动词“conglobe”的现在分词/动名词形式，但这个词在现代英语里非常少见，多见于较旧或较书面的描写（尤其是医学/生物/化学里描述“凝结成团”）。
更常见、更自然的表达包括：clumping together（结块）、coalescing（聚合/合并）、forming into a ball（形成球状）、congealing（凝固成块）。

summary.en: “Conglobulate” means to gather into a compact, rounded mass or to clump together (formal/rare).
summary.zh: “conglobulate”指“聚成紧密的团块/球状”，较正式且少见。

definition.en: to gather or form into a compact round mass; to clump together
definition.zh: 聚成一团；凝结成球状（或紧密的一团）

examples.en: Dust can conglobulate into little balls when it mixes with moisture.
examples.zh: 灰尘和湿气混在一起时，可能会凝成一个个小团。

examples.en: After the storm, seaweed conglobulated along the shoreline.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，海藻在海岸线上聚成一堆堆。

extraExplanation: “conglobulate”较为罕见、偏书面或科学语境。日常英语更常用：clump (together)、cluster、gather (into a ball/mass)。
词源来自拉丁语：con-（一起）+ globus（球、团）。因此它常带有“变成球状/团块状”的画面感。

summary.en: “Conglomerate” most often means a large business group owning many companies in different industries; it can also mean a mixed collection or the act of combining into one whole.
summary.zh: “Conglomerate”最常指跨行业拥有多家公司的大型企业集团；也可指由不同部分组成的混合体，或表示把不同事物合并成整体。

definition.en: A large company made up of many smaller companies in different industries, usually owned and controlled as one group.
definition.zh: （由多家不同行业的公司组成、通常由同一集团控制的）企业集团；联合企业

examples.en: The conglomerate owns businesses in banking, media, and food production.
examples.zh: 这家企业集团在银行、媒体和食品生产等领域都有业务。

examples.en: After the merger, the brand became part of a global conglomerate.
examples.zh: 合并后，这个品牌成了某个全球性企业集团的一部分。

definition.en: To bring together different things—often companies or parts—into one larger whole.
definition.zh: 使（不同事物，尤指公司或业务）联合成一体；合并成更大的整体

examples.en: Several small firms conglomerated to compete with bigger rivals.
examples.zh: 几家小公司联合起来，以便与更大的竞争对手抗衡。

examples.en: The company conglomerated its regional offices into one headquarters.
examples.zh: 公司把各地办事处整合到一个总部里。

definition.en: A thing made of many different parts stuck or packed together; a mixture.
definition.zh: （由多种不同部分黏结或聚合而成的）混合物；聚合体

examples.en: The report was a conglomerate of notes, charts, and personal opinions.
examples.zh: 这份报告是笔记、图表和个人观点拼在一起的混合体。

examples.en: The museum described the style as a conglomerate of influences.
examples.zh: 博物馆称这种风格是多种影响的聚合体。

extraExplanation: 词源提示：con- 表示“共同”，-glomer- 来自拉丁语 glomus（“线团、团块”）。所以它的核心感觉是“把许多东西聚成一团”。
用法区分：在商业语境中，conglomerate（企业集团）通常指跨行业、多元化经营的公司集团；如果是同一行业内整合并扩张，更常用 group 或 corporation，或在反垄断语境中讨论 merger / acquisition（并购）。

summary.en: “Conglomerated” means combined or merged into a single whole; it can also describe conglomerate rock in geology.
summary.zh: “conglomerated”表示“合并/整合成整体的”；在地质中也可指“由砾石胶结成的砾岩”。

definition.en: (adj.) Formed by combining many different parts, things, or groups into one whole; mixed together.
definition.zh: （形容词）由许多不同部分、事物或群体合并而成的；混合在一起的。

examples.en: The company is a conglomerated business with interests in media, finance, and retail.
examples.zh: 这家公司是一家综合性企业，业务涵盖媒体、金融和零售。

examples.en: After the merger, two separate teams became a single conglomerated department.
examples.zh: 合并之后，两个独立团队变成了一个整合后的部门。

definition.en: (v.) Past tense/past participle of “conglomerate”: to bring together into a single mass or group; to merge.
definition.zh: （动词）“conglomerate”的过去式/过去分词：把……聚合成一体；合并。

examples.en: Several small firms conglomerated into one larger organization.
examples.zh: 几家小公司合并成了一家更大的机构。

examples.en: Data from multiple sources was conglomerated into one report for the meeting.
examples.zh: 来自多个来源的数据被汇总成一份报告，用于会议。

definition.en: (adj., geology) Made of rounded stones or gravel naturally cemented together (conglomerate rock).
definition.zh: （形容词，地质）由圆砾或碎石自然胶结而成的（砾岩）。

examples.en: The cliff is made of conglomerated rock, with pebbles visible in the surface.
examples.zh: 这段悬崖由砾岩构成，表面能看到许多小卵石。

extraExplanation: 词源提示：conglomerate 来自拉丁语 con-（一起）+ glomerare（团成一团），与 glomerulus（肾小球）同源，都有“聚成团”的意象。
用法提示：conglomerated 常见于商务/学术语境，表示“并入、整合后的”。日常口语里更常用 combined / merged / mixed。

summary.en: “Conglomerates” most often means large diversified business groups; it can also mean certain mixed-stone rocks, and it can be the verb form meaning “combines into a group.”
summary.zh: “Conglomerates”最常指多元化经营的大型企业集团；也可指地质上的砾岩；还可作动词形式，表示“合并/整合成集团”。

definition.en: Large companies formed by combining many different businesses; large business groups that operate in several unrelated industries.
definition.zh: 由许多不同业务合并而成的巨型公司；跨多个（常常不相关）行业经营的大型企业集团。

examples.en: Many media conglomerates also own film studios, TV networks, and publishing companies.
examples.zh: 许多媒体集团同时拥有电影制片厂、电视台和出版社。

examples.en: The government investigated whether the conglomerates had too much market power.
examples.zh: 政府调查这些大型企业集团是否拥有过大的市场力量。

definition.en: Third-person singular form of “conglomerate”: to combine different companies or parts into one large group.
definition.zh: “conglomerate”的第三人称单数：把不同公司或部门合并成一个大型集团。

examples.en: The firm conglomerates its smaller brands under one umbrella name.
examples.zh: 这家公司把较小的品牌整合到同一个母品牌之下。

examples.en: When an industry conglomerates, a few big players may dominate the market.
examples.zh: 当一个行业发生集团化整合时，少数巨头可能主导市场。

definition.en: In geology, rocks made of many rounded stones (pebbles) naturally cemented together.
definition.zh: 【地质】由许多圆磨砾石自然胶结在一起形成的砾岩。

examples.en: The cliff layer contains conglomerates formed by ancient river deposits.
examples.zh: 这处悬崖的岩层含有由古代河流沉积形成的砾岩。

extraExplanation: 在商业语境里，conglomerate 常带有“多元化经营”的意味：集团可能同时做食品、金融、房地产等彼此不太相关的行业，用来分散风险或扩大规模。
词源上来自拉丁语 con-（一起）+ glomerare（聚成团），核心感觉是“把许多东西聚拢成一团/一体”。

summary.en: Conlomeratic is a rare adjective, mainly used in geology, meaning “related to or resembling conglomerate rock,” and more loosely “mixed from many parts.”
summary.zh: conglomeratic 是个较罕见的形容词，主要用于地质学，表示“与砾岩有关/类似砾岩的”，引申可指“杂糅拼凑的”。

definition.en: (rare; geology) Made of, relating to, or resembling a conglomerate (a rock made of rounded pebbles cemented together).
definition.zh: （罕见；地质）由砾岩构成的；与砾岩有关的；类似砾岩的（砾石被胶结在一起形成的岩石）。

examples.en: The cliff shows a conglomeratic layer filled with rounded stones.
examples.zh: 这处悬崖露出一层砾岩性岩层，里面充满圆润的卵石。

examples.en: Geologists mapped conglomeratic deposits along the ancient river channel.
examples.zh: 地质学家沿着古河道绘制了砾岩性沉积物的分布图。

definition.en: (uncommon; figurative) Mixed together in a rough, “lumpy” way; made from many different parts.
definition.zh: （不常用；引申）杂糅的、混合拼凑的；由许多不同部分组成但不够统一的。

examples.en: The museum’s early collection felt conglomeratic—interesting but not well organized.
examples.zh: 这家博物馆的早期馆藏给人一种杂糅感——很有趣，但组织得不够清晰。

extraExplanation: “conglomeratic”在日常英语里非常少见，更多出现在地质学写作中。一般写作中更常用的是“conglomerate”（名词：砾岩/企业集团；形容词：混合的）。
如果你想表达“企业集团的”，英语里通常说“conglomerate company / conglomerate group”，或用“conglomerate”（作形容词）；而不是“conglomeratic”。

summary.en: “Conglomerating” means combining separate things—ideas, data, groups, or companies—into one larger whole.
summary.zh: “Conglomerating”表示把分散的事物（想法、数据、群体或公司）合并成一个更大的整体。

definition.en: combining different things into one larger group, mass, or whole
definition.zh: 把不同的事物合并成一个更大的整体、集合或团块

examples.en: The report is conglomerating data from several hospitals into one national database.
examples.zh: 这份报告正在把几家医院的数据汇总到一个全国数据库中。

examples.en: Over time, small communities began conglomerating into a single city.
examples.zh: 随着时间推移，小社区逐渐合并成一座城市。

definition.en: (business) joining or buying different companies so they operate under one corporate group
definition.zh: （商业）把不同公司合并或收购，组成同一个企业集团

examples.en: The firm is conglomerating several brands to reduce costs and share resources.
examples.zh: 这家公司正在把几个品牌整合到同一集团，以降低成本并共享资源。

examples.en: After conglomerating with a competitor, the company expanded into new markets.
examples.zh: 与竞争对手合并后，公司进入了新市场。

extraExplanation: “conglomerating”是动词“conglomerate”的现在分词/动名词形式。它既可以指一般意义上的“聚合、合并”，也常用于商业语境，指“组成/形成企业集团（conglomerate）”。
词源上与拉丁语 con-（一起）+ glomus（团、球）有关，核心画面感是“把许多东西聚成一团/一块”。

summary.en: Conglomeration means a mixed group of different things, or a large corporate group made from several companies.
summary.zh: conglomeration 指不同事物杂糅而成的整体，也可指由多家公司组成（常跨行业）的企业集团。

definition.en: a group of different things (or people) brought together into one whole, often in a mixed or not very organized way
definition.zh: 由不同事物（或人）混合聚在一起形成的整体，常带有“杂糅、拼合”的感觉

examples.en: The city is a conglomeration of cultures, languages, and food traditions.
examples.zh: 这座城市是多元文化、语言和饮食传统的汇合体。

examples.en: His desk was a conglomeration of books, cables, and half-finished notes.
examples.zh: 他的桌子上杂乱地堆着书、本线和写到一半的笔记。

definition.en: a large business formed by joining together several different companies, often in different industries
definition.zh: 由多家（常跨行业的）公司合并或组成的大型企业集团

examples.en: The media conglomeration owns TV stations, newspapers, and streaming services.
examples.zh: 这家媒体集团拥有电视台、报纸和流媒体服务。

examples.en: After the merger, the conglomeration expanded into finance and health care.
examples.zh: 合并后，这个企业集团扩展到了金融和医疗领域。

extraExplanation: 词源提示：con- 表示“共同、一起”，glom-/glomer- 与“团块、球团”有关，-ation 表示“过程/结果”。整体给人一种“把不同东西团在一起”的画面。
用法对比：conglomeration 常强调“混杂地聚合”；collection 更中性（收藏/集合）；combination 强调“组合方式”；mixture 强调“混合后的成分”。商业语境里，常见同义表达是 business conglomerate（企业集团）。
文学/报道中常用于强调现代社会的“多元拼贴感”或“大公司跨行业扩张”的现象，语气可中性也可略带批评（暗示过度集中或杂糅）。

summary.en: “Conglomerations” means mixed groups or masses formed by combining different parts, or large business groups made from many companies.
summary.zh: “conglomerations”指由不同成分组合而成的聚合体/混合体，也可指由多家公司组成的大型企业集团。

definition.en: Groups of different things gathered or stuck together into a larger whole.
definition.zh: 由不同事物聚集、黏合或组合在一起形成的整体；混合聚合体。

examples.en: The beach was covered with conglomerations of shells, seaweed, and driftwood after the storm.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，海滩上满是贝壳、海藻和漂流木的混合堆积物。

examples.en: In the museum, the artist displayed conglomerations of metal scraps and glass.
examples.zh: 在博物馆里，这位艺术家展出了金属碎片与玻璃组合而成的聚合物。

definition.en: Large companies formed by joining together many smaller companies, often in different industries.
definition.zh: 由多家（常跨行业的）公司合并组成的大型企业集团。

examples.en: Several media conglomerations control many TV channels and news sites.
examples.zh: 一些媒体企业集团掌控着许多电视频道和新闻网站。

examples.en: As conglomerations grow, they may face more government regulation.
examples.zh: 当企业集团扩大时，可能会面临更多政府监管。

extraExplanation: “conglomerations”是复数形式，单数是“conglomeration”。
在地质学里，conglomeration也可指“砾岩/砾质岩”（由圆砾等被胶结在一起形成的岩石），属于更专门的用法。

summary.en: Conglomerative means “formed by combining many different parts into one whole,” and it can also describe conglomerate rock in geology.
summary.zh: Conglomerative 指“由许多不同部分聚合而成的”；在地质语境中也可指“砾岩（由砾石胶结而成）的”。

definition.en: Made up of many different parts or elements that are joined together; formed by combining things into a whole.
definition.zh: 由许多不同部分或要素结合而成的；通过聚合、合并形成整体的。

examples.en: The report gives a conglomerative picture of public opinion by combining several surveys.
examples.zh: 这份报告把多项调查合并起来，呈现出公众意见的综合图景。

examples.en: Her essay takes a conglomerative approach, mixing history, interviews, and personal stories.
examples.zh: 她的文章采用一种综合式写法，把历史、访谈和个人故事混合在一起。

definition.en: (Geology) Related to a conglomerate rock, made of rounded pebbles or fragments cemented together.
definition.zh: （地质）与砾岩有关的；由圆磨砾石或碎屑胶结在一起形成的。

examples.en: The cliffs contain conglomerative layers with visible pebbles embedded in the rock.
examples.zh: 这些峭壁中有砾岩层，能看到岩石里嵌着的砾石。

extraExplanation: “conglomerative”来自“conglomerate（聚合体/联合企业/砾岩）”，核心意思是“聚合在一起”。在日常英语里它相对少见，人们更常用“composite（复合的）”“mixed（混合的）”“combined（结合的）”。在学术写作中偶尔用来强调“由不同来源汇聚而成”的特征。

summary.en: A rare noun meaning someone or something that combines separate parts into a larger whole.
summary.zh: 一个较少见的名词，指把不同部分合并成更大整体的人或物。

definition.en: a person, company, or thing that conglomerates—combines different parts, businesses, or materials into one larger whole
definition.zh: 把不同部分、企业或材料“合并成一体”的人、公司或装置；聚合者、并合者

examples.en: The startup acted as a conglomerator, buying small apps and merging them into one platform.
examples.zh: 这家初创公司像个“并购整合者”，收购小型应用并把它们合并到一个平台上。

examples.en: In the report, the parent company is described as the conglomerator behind several unrelated brands.
examples.zh: 报告中把母公司描述为多个不相关品牌背后的“集团整合者”。

extraExplanation: “conglomerator”在现代英语里比较少见，更常用的是动词/名词“conglomerate”（合并；企业集团）或名词“conglomerate company / conglomerate”（企业集团）。在正式写作中，很多场景用“acquirer”（收购方）、“aggregator”（聚合平台/整合者）、“consolidator”（整合者、并表者）会更自然。

summary.en: “Conglomeritic” is a geology adjective meaning “related to or resembling conglomerate rock.”
summary.zh: “Conglomeritic”是一个地质学形容词，意思是“与砾岩有关的；类似砾岩的；砾岩性的”。

definition.en: (Geology) Made of, resembling, or relating to conglomerate rock (a sedimentary rock with rounded pebbles or gravel cemented together).
definition.zh: （地质）由砾岩构成的；类似砾岩的；与砾岩有关的（砾岩是一种由圆磨砾石/卵石被胶结在一起形成的沉积岩）。

examples.en: The river terrace exposes a conglomeritic layer with rounded pebbles.
examples.zh: 河流阶地露出一层砾岩状地层，里面有圆磨的卵石。

examples.en: Conglomeritic deposits often indicate high-energy water flow, such as fast rivers.
examples.zh: 砾岩性沉积物常常表明水动力较强，比如湍急的河流环境。

extraExplanation: “Conglomeritic”是地质学术语，日常英语里很少用。它通常用来修饰rock/layer/bed/deposit/sediment（岩石/地层/层/沉积物/沉积物质），强调其颗粒较粗、含砾成分多、外观或成因接近“conglomerate（砾岩）”。
常见对比：conglomeritic（砾岩性的，含砾或类似砾岩）≠ conglomerate（名词：砾岩；也可作形容词表示“砾岩的/聚合的”）。在论文或地质报告中，“conglomeritic sandstone（砾岩质砂岩）”表示砂岩里夹杂较多砾石。

summary.en: Conglutin is a technical noun meaning a type of protein found especially in lupin seeds.
summary.zh: Conglutin 是一个专业名词，指主要存在于羽扇豆种子中的一种蛋白质。

definition.en: A type of seed storage protein found especially in lupin (lupine) seeds; often discussed in nutrition and food science.
definition.zh: 一种种子贮藏蛋白，常见于羽扇豆（鲁冰花属、lupin/lupine）种子中；多见于营养学与食品科学语境。

examples.en: Some studies look at lupin conglutin to understand how it affects blood sugar after meals.
examples.zh: 一些研究会关注羽扇豆的 conglutin，以了解它对餐后血糖的影响。

examples.en: The product label mentions lupin protein; in research papers, you may see specific names like conglutin.
examples.zh: 产品标签可能写“羽扇豆蛋白”；而在论文里，你可能会看到更具体的名称，比如 conglutin。

extraExplanation: conglutin 不是日常英语词汇，主要出现在生物化学、营养学、食品科学文献中，常与“lupin/羽扇豆蛋白”“过敏原（allergen）”“功能性蛋白”等话题一起出现。
词源上与拉丁语中表示“黏合/胶合”的词根有关（与 coagulate 等词在“凝聚/结块”的意象上相近），但在现代用法里它更多是一个专门的蛋白名称。

summary.en: Conglutinant means “glue-like” (adj.) or “an adhesive substance” (n.).
summary.zh: conglutinant 指“具有黏合作用的”（形容词）或“黏合剂/黏着物”（名词）。

definition.en: (adj.) Causing things to stick together; acting like a glue or adhesive.
definition.zh: （形容词）使物体黏合在一起的；起“胶水/黏着剂”作用的。

examples.en: The conglutinant resin helped the broken pieces hold together.
examples.zh: 这种具有黏合作用的树脂帮助断裂的碎片粘在一起。

examples.en: In the lab, a conglutinant agent was added to bind the particles.
examples.zh: 在实验室里加入了一种黏合剂来把颗粒结合起来。

definition.en: (n.) A substance that makes materials stick together; an adhesive.
definition.zh: （名词）黏合物；黏着剂；胶黏剂。

examples.en: They used a natural conglutinant made from plant sap.
examples.zh: 他们使用了一种由植物汁液制成的天然黏合剂。

examples.en: Early bookbinders sometimes relied on animal-based conglutinants.
examples.zh: 早期装订工有时会依赖动物性黏合剂。

extraExplanation: 这个词比较少见，多见于较正式或专业语境（如生物学、材料、古籍装订等）。日常英语里更常用 adhesive / glue / binder。
词源来自拉丁语 conglutinare（使黏合），与 glutin-（胶、黏性）有关，也能帮助你理解 gluten（麸质）这个词同样源自“黏”。

summary.en: Conglutinate means to stick together (or make things stick together) into a single mass, often used in scientific or medical contexts.
summary.zh: Conglutinate 指（自身）黏合/凝结成一团，或使某物黏合成一体，常用于医学或科学语境。

definition.en: (of a material or tissue) to stick together into a mass; to glue or clump together.
definition.zh: （材料或组织）黏合成一团；凝结、结块。

examples.en: The damp powder began to conglutinate in the jar.
examples.zh: 这份潮湿的粉末在罐子里开始结块。

examples.en: After the inflammation, the tissues may conglutinate and form adhesions.
examples.zh: 发炎后，组织可能会黏连并形成粘连。

definition.en: to cause something to stick together; to cement or bind into one mass.
definition.zh: 使……黏合在一起；把……胶合/粘成一体。

examples.en: Heat can conglutinate small particles into larger lumps.
examples.zh: 加热会使小颗粒黏合成更大的块状物。

examples.en: The paste conglutinated the fibers, making the surface tougher.
examples.zh: 糊状物把纤维黏合在一起，使表面更结实。

extraExplanation: 这个词在日常口语中很少见，更常见于医学/生物学或较正式的书面语（例如描述“组织粘连”“颗粒凝聚”）。
词源来自拉丁语 con-（共同）+ gluten（胶、黏性物），同根词包括 gluten（面筋；黏性物）、conglutination（黏合；凝聚）。

summary.en: “Conglutinated” means stuck or glued together into a clump; it’s a formal/scientific word.
summary.zh: “Conglutinated”表示“粘结在一起、凝结成团”，多用于正式或科学语境。

definition.en: Stuck together into a mass; clumped or glued together (often used in biology or technical writing).
definition.zh: （常用于生物或技术语境）粘结在一起的；凝结成团的。

examples.en: The spores were conglutinated into a sticky clump.
examples.zh: 孢子粘结成了一团黏糊糊的块状物。

examples.en: After the solution cooled, small particles became conglutinated at the bottom of the tube.
examples.zh: 溶液冷却后，小颗粒在试管底部凝结成团。

definition.en: Past participle of “conglutinate”: to cause things to stick together; to unite by glue-like adhesion.
definition.zh: “conglutinate”的过去分词：使……粘在一起；使……胶合、黏合。

examples.en: The resin conglutinated the fibers into a single sheet.
examples.zh: 树脂把纤维黏合成一整张片材。

examples.en: In some fungi, cells can be conglutinated by a gelatinous substance.
examples.zh: 在某些真菌中，细胞会被胶状物质黏结在一起。

extraExplanation: 该词较正式，日常英语中更常用 **stuck together / clumped together / glued together / matted** 来表达类似意思。
词源上与拉丁语 *gluten*（“胶、黏性物”）有关，因此常见于描述“像胶一样把东西粘在一起”的科学语境（如显微观察、化学沉淀、生物组织等）。

summary.en: Conglutinating usually describes something that joins parts together; in linguistics, it refers to agglutinative word-building by adding clear, separate morphemes.
summary.zh: Conglutinating 通常指“黏合/凝结在一起的”；在语言学中指黏着型构词：通过添加意义清晰、彼此分离的语素来构成词。

definition.en: (linguistics) Forming words by joining many small parts (morphemes) together, with each part usually having a clear, separate meaning.
definition.zh: （语言学）用许多小的语素“黏合/拼接”来构成词，每个部分通常都有清晰、独立的意义。

examples.en: Turkish is often described as a conglutinating (agglutinative) language.
examples.zh: 土耳其语常被描述为一种黏着型（黏合式/粘着式）的语言。

examples.en: In conglutinating languages, a single word can express what would be a whole sentence in English.
examples.zh: 在黏着型语言中，一个词可能表达英语里需要一整句才能表达的意思。

definition.en: (less common) Joining or sticking together; causing things to glue together.
definition.zh: （较少见）使……黏在一起的；黏合的；凝结在一起的。

examples.en: A conglutinating substance can bind small particles into a solid mass.
examples.zh: 一种黏合性物质可以把小颗粒黏结成一个固体块。

definition.en: Present participle of “conglutinate”: to join or glue together (often used in technical or formal contexts).
definition.zh: “conglutinate”的现在分词：使……黏合在一起/凝结在一起（常见于技术或正式语境）。

examples.en: Heat is conglutinating the resin and fibers into a stronger material.
examples.zh: 热量正在把树脂和纤维黏合成更坚固的材料。

extraExplanation: 在语言学里，更常用的术语是 **agglutinative（黏着型）**，而 **conglutinating** 属于较少见但含义相近的说法。黏着型语言的典型特点是“一个语素通常对应一个语法意义”，比如表示时态、人称、格、数等的成分会像积木一样一个个加在词根后面。与之对比：**fusional（屈折型）**语言常常“一个词尾同时表达多个语法意义”。

summary.en: Conglutination means sticking or gluing together, especially the clumping of particles, cells, or tissues.
summary.zh: Conglutination 指“黏合/黏连在一起”，尤其可指颗粒、细胞或组织的凝集结块。

definition.en: the act or process of sticking or gluing things together; a union formed by adhesion
definition.zh: （事物）黏合、胶合在一起的过程；黏附形成的结合体

examples.en: Heat can cause conglutination of small particles into larger lumps.
examples.zh: 加热会使小颗粒发生黏结，形成更大的团块。

examples.en: The lab noted conglutination of the sample after the solution cooled.
examples.zh: 实验室记录到溶液冷却后样本出现黏合现象。

definition.en: (biology/medicine) a clumping or sticking together of cells or tissues, especially by a sticky substance
definition.zh: （生物/医学）细胞或组织的凝集、黏连（常因黏性物质导致）

examples.en: The report described conglutination of red blood cells in the test tube.
examples.zh: 报告描述了试管中红细胞发生凝集。

examples.en: Inflammation sometimes leads to conglutination of nearby tissues.
examples.zh: 炎症有时会导致邻近组织发生黏连。

extraExplanation: 词源上来自拉丁语 con-（一起）+ glutinare（用胶黏合），与英文 glue（胶水）、gluten（麸质；也有“黏性”联想）同源，核心感觉都是“黏在一起”。
在日常英语里 conglutination 比较少见，更常见的替代表达有 sticking together / clumping / adhesion；在医学与生物语境中也常用 agglutination（凝集，常指细胞/颗粒在反应中“聚成团”）。
阅读学术文章时，如果看到 conglutination，通常是在描述“因为黏性或胶状物质导致的黏连/结块”，强调“胶一样的黏合”这一点。

summary.en: Describing a language/word formation style where words are formed by attaching multiple clear, meaningful parts (morphemes).
summary.zh: 指通过连接多个清晰可分、各自带意义的词素来构词的语言或构词方式（常近似于“黏着型”）。

definition.en: (Linguistics) Describing a language or word formation style in which words are built by “gluing together” several clearly separable parts (morphemes), each usually carrying one grammatical meaning.
definition.zh: （语言学）指一种语言或构词方式：通过把多个清晰可分的词素“粘合”在一起构成词，每个词素通常表达一个语法意义。

examples.en: Turkish is often described as a conglutinative language because it adds many suffixes to a word stem.
examples.zh: 土耳其语常被描述为黏着型（conglutinative）语言，因为它会在词干后加上许多后缀。

examples.en: In a conglutinative system, you can often identify the meaning of each ending separately.
examples.zh: 在黏着型系统中，你通常可以把每个词尾的意义单独辨认出来。

extraExplanation: “Conglutinative”常用于介绍语言类型（language typology）。更常见、也更标准的术语是“agglutinative（黏着语的）”。两者意思非常接近：强调词素像积木一样一段段拼接、边界清晰。
词源上与拉丁语 glutin-（“胶、黏合”）有关，因此有“粘在一起”的形象比喻。
在实际英语写作里，这个词较少见，学术场合多用 agglutinative；如果你在论文或课堂中看到 conglutinative，通常是在用“黏合式”的比喻来说明同一概念。

summary.en: Conclusion means the end of something, or an opinion/decision reached after thinking.
summary.zh: Conclusion 指某事的结尾，也指经过思考得出的结论或决定。

definition.en: the end of something (such as a story, event, or process); the finishing part
definition.zh: 结尾；结束部分（如故事、事件或过程的最后部分）

examples.en: The conclusion of the movie was surprising.
examples.zh: 电影的结尾很令人惊讶。

examples.en: We’re nearing the conclusion of the meeting.
examples.zh: 会议快要结束了。

definition.en: a judgment or opinion reached after thinking carefully; a decision you arrive at
definition.zh: 结论；推断（经过思考后得出的判断或观点）

examples.en: After looking at the evidence, she came to the conclusion that he was telling the truth.
examples.zh: 看过证据后，她得出结论：他说的是真话。

examples.en: What conclusion did you draw from the data?
examples.zh: 你从数据中得出了什么结论？

definition.en: an agreement or settlement (especially in formal or legal contexts)
definition.zh: （尤指正式或法律语境中的）协议；和解；达成的结果

examples.en: The two sides reached a conclusion after weeks of talks.
examples.zh: 经过数周谈判，双方达成了协议。

extraExplanation: 你输入的 **conglution** 很可能是拼写错误。最常见的目标词是 **conclusion**（结论/结尾）。
记忆小提示：**conclusion** 来自 *conclude*（结束；下结论）。常见搭配有 **come to a conclusion**（得出结论）、**in conclusion**（总之，用于结尾总结）。

summary.en: Congo usually refers to either of two Central African countries, and it can also mean the Congo River or the wider Congo region/basin.
summary.zh: Congo 通常指中非的两个国家之一，也可指刚果河或更广义的刚果地区/刚果盆地。

definition.en: A name used for two neighboring countries in Central Africa: the Republic of the Congo (capital: Brazzaville) and the Democratic Republic of the Congo (capital: Kinshasa).
definition.zh: 中非的两个相邻国家的名称：刚果共和国（首都布拉柴维尔）与刚果民主共和国/刚果（金）（首都金沙萨）。

examples.en: She is traveling to the Democratic Republic of the Congo for a research project.
examples.zh: 她要去刚果民主共和国做研究项目。

examples.en: The Republic of the Congo and the DRC are different countries with different capitals.
examples.zh: 刚果共和国和刚果民主共和国是不同的国家，首都也不同。

definition.en: The Congo River, a major river in Central Africa.
definition.zh: 刚果河：中非的一条重要河流。

examples.en: The Congo River is one of the deepest rivers in the world.
examples.zh: 刚果河是世界上最深的河流之一。

definition.en: The Congo region or Congo Basin area in Central Africa (often discussed in geography, ecology, or history).
definition.zh: 刚果地区/刚果盆地（常用于地理、生态或历史语境）。

examples.en: The Congo Basin contains vast tropical rainforests.
examples.zh: 刚果盆地拥有广阔的热带雨林。

extraExplanation: 英语里单独说“Congo”容易引起歧义，因为它可能指两个国家之一。为避免混淆，常见写法是：Democratic Republic of the Congo（DRC，中文常写“刚果（金）”）和 Republic of the Congo（中文常写“刚果（布）”）。
与之相关的形容词/国籍词是 Congolese（“刚果的；刚果人”），可指两个国家的人或事物，具体要看上下文。
在文学与历史语境中，“the Congo”有时不仅是地名，也会指殖民历史、探险叙事或雨林生态（如约瑟夫·康拉德《黑暗之心》常被提及）。

summary.en: Congo commonly refers to either of two Central African countries, and it can also mean the Congo River or the Congo Basin.
summary.zh: Congo（刚果）常指中非两个国家之一，也可指刚果河或刚果盆地。

definition.en: a name used for two countries in Central Africa: the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) and the Republic of the Congo
definition.zh: “刚果”常指中非的两个国家：刚果民主共和国（刚果（金），DRC）和刚果共和国（刚果（布））

examples.en: She worked on a public health project in the Democratic Republic of the Congo.
examples.zh: 她在刚果民主共和国参与了一个公共卫生项目。

examples.en: Brazzaville is the capital of the Republic of the Congo.
examples.zh: 布拉柴维尔是刚果共和国的首都。

definition.en: the Congo River, a major river in Central Africa
definition.zh: 刚果河：中非的一条重要河流

examples.en: The Congo River is one of the deepest rivers in the world.
examples.zh: 刚果河是世界上最深的河流之一。

definition.en: the Congo Basin, a large rainforest region around the Congo River
definition.zh: 刚果盆地：围绕刚果河的大型热带雨林地区

examples.en: The Congo Basin is home to many unique plants and animals.
examples.zh: 刚果盆地拥有许多独特的动植物。

extraExplanation: “Congo”在新闻和日常英语里有时会让人混淆，因为它可能指两个不同的国家。写作或正式场合常用全名来避免歧义：Democratic Republic of the Congo（DRC，常译“刚果（金）”，首都KInshasa金沙萨）与Republic of the Congo（常译“刚果（布）”，首都Brazzaville布拉柴维尔）。
在文学与流行文化中，“the Congo”有时也被用来泛指中非的丛林与河流地区（更接近“Congo Basin”的意象），但这种用法可能带有刻板印象；更准确的表达会具体说Congo River或Congo Basin。

summary.en: “Congoes” is not common modern English; it’s usually a misspelling of “Congos,” meaning more than one “Congo.”
summary.zh: “congoes”在现代英语中不常见，通常是把“Congos”误写了，表示不止一个“Congo（刚果）”。

definition.en: Plural form of “Congo” (the name of a country/region). In modern English, this spelling is uncommon; people usually write “the Congo” (for the region/river) or use specific country names.
definition.zh: “Congo”的复数形式（国家/地区名称）。但在现代英语里这种拼写不常见；更常见的说法是“the Congo”（指地区/河流），或直接用具体国名。

examples.en: Historically, writers sometimes spoke of “the two Congos,” meaning two different countries in the Congo region.
examples.zh: 历史写作中，有时会说“the two Congos”，指刚果地区的两个不同国家。

examples.en: Today, it’s clearer to say “the Republic of the Congo” and “the Democratic Republic of the Congo.”
examples.zh: 如今更清晰的说法是“the Republic of the Congo（刚果共和国）”和“the Democratic Republic of the Congo（刚果民主共和国）”。

extraExplanation: “congoes”很可能是把“Congos”误写成了“congoes”。如果你想表达“刚果人”，英语通常用“Congolese”（既可作形容词也可作名词，如：Congolese music / a Congolese）。
如果你指的是两国并列，常见表达是“the two Congos”，但在正式/清晰写法中，更推荐直接写全称：Republic of the Congo 与 Democratic Republic of the Congo。

summary.en: Congolese means “from the Congo,” and it can describe people or things related to either Congo country; it can also mean a person from there.
summary.zh: Congolese 指“来自刚果（地区/国家）”，可形容与两个“刚果”国家相关的人或事物，也可指刚果人。

definition.en: (Spelling note) The usual spelling is “Congolese,” meaning related to the Congo region, especially the people, languages, or culture of the Democratic Republic of the Congo or the Republic of the Congo.
definition.zh: （拼写提示）常见拼写是“Congolese”，表示与刚果地区有关，尤指刚果民主共和国或刚果共和国的人民、语言或文化。

examples.en: I met a Congolese student at the language exchange.
examples.zh: 我在语言交流活动中认识了一位刚果学生。

examples.en: Congolese music is popular across Africa and beyond.
examples.zh: 刚果音乐在非洲乃至更广范围都很受欢迎。

definition.en: A person from the Democratic Republic of the Congo or the Republic of the Congo.
definition.zh: 刚果人（来自刚果民主共和国或刚果共和国的人）。

examples.en: She is Congolese and speaks French at school.
examples.zh: 她是刚果人，在学校说法语。

examples.en: Many Congolese live in Kinshasa, the capital of the DRC.
examples.zh: 许多刚果人住在刚果（金），也就是刚果民主共和国的首都。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“Congoese”一般被视为拼写错误；标准拼写是“Congolese”。
“Congolese”可能指两国之一：刚果民主共和国（DRC，首都金沙萨 Kinshasa）或刚果共和国（首都布拉柴维尔 Brazzaville）。如果需要更明确，可以说“from the DRC / from the Republic of the Congo”。

summary.en: “Congolese” means “from the Congo” (adj.) or “a person from the Congo” (n.). “Congoese” is a common misspelling.
summary.zh: “Congolese”表示“刚果的”（形容词）或“刚果人”（名词）；“congoese”常为拼写错误。

definition.en: relating to the Congo, or to its people, languages, or cultures (especially the Democratic Republic of the Congo or the Republic of the Congo).
definition.zh: 与刚果有关的；刚果（人、语言或文化）的（常指刚果民主共和国或刚果共和国）。

examples.en: Congolese music is famous for its dance rhythms.
examples.zh: 刚果音乐以其舞曲节奏而闻名。

examples.en: She studies Congolese history in college.
examples.zh: 她在大学里学习刚果历史。

definition.en: a person from the Congo (or of Congolese origin).
definition.zh: 刚果人；刚果裔人士。

examples.en: Many Congolese speak more than one language.
examples.zh: 许多刚果人会说不止一种语言。

examples.en: He is Congolese, but he grew up in the U.S.
examples.zh: 他是刚果人，但在美国长大。

extraExplanation: “Congoese”通常被视为拼写错误；标准拼写是 **Congolese**。
“Congolese”可以指两个国家的国民/事物：**刚果民主共和国**（DR Congo, 首都金沙萨）和 **刚果共和国**（Republic of the Congo, 首都布拉柴维尔）。在写作中如果需要更清楚，可说 “from DR Congo / from the Republic of the Congo”。

summary.en: Congolese means “from Congo” (either the DRC or the Republic of the Congo) or “a person from Congo.”
summary.zh: Congolese 指“刚果的/与刚果有关的”（可指刚果民主共和国或刚果共和国），也可指“刚果人”。

definition.en: from or relating to the Democratic Republic of the Congo or the Republic of the Congo, or to their people, languages, or culture.
definition.zh: （与）刚果民主共和国或刚果共和国（及其）人民、语言或文化有关的；刚果的。

examples.en: She studies Congolese music and dance.
examples.zh: 她研究刚果的音乐与舞蹈。

examples.en: Congolese cuisine often includes cassava and plantains.
examples.zh: 刚果菜肴常见木薯和大蕉。

definition.en: a person from the Democratic Republic of the Congo or the Republic of the Congo.
definition.zh: 刚果人（指来自刚果民主共和国或刚果共和国的人）。

examples.en: Many Congolese live in Kinshasa, a very large city.
examples.zh: 许多刚果人生活在金沙萨，这是一座非常大的城市。

examples.en: He is Congolese and speaks French at school.
examples.zh: 他是刚果人，在学校说法语。

extraExplanation: “Congolese”对应两個國家：剛果民主共和國（首都金沙薩，常簡稱 DRC）和剛果共和國（首都布拉柴維爾）。因為兩國名稱相近，英文寫作中常用 “DRC/Republic of the Congo” 來避免混淆。
文化與語言方面，“Congolese”很廣泛：兩國都有法語作官方語言之一，也有多種本地語言（例如林加拉語 Lingala、基孔戈語 Kikongo 等）。因此在描述時可更具體，如 “Congolese Lingala songs”（剛果林加拉語歌曲）。

summary.en: Congolese means “from or related to the Congo,” and it can refer to either of the two countries named Congo (DRC or Republic of the Congo).
summary.zh: Congolese 意为“来自/与刚果有关”，可指刚果民主共和国或刚果共和国（需结合语境）。

definition.en: relating to the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) or the Republic of the Congo, or to their people, languages, or culture
definition.zh: 与刚果民主共和国（DRC）或刚果共和国有关的；与其人民、语言或文化有关的

examples.en: Congolese music has influenced many modern African pop styles.
examples.zh: 刚果音乐影响了许多现代非洲流行音乐风格。

examples.en: She studies Congolese history in her African studies class.
examples.zh: 她在非洲研究课上学习刚果历史。

definition.en: a person from the Democratic Republic of the Congo or the Republic of the Congo
definition.zh: 刚果人（指来自刚果民主共和国或刚果共和国的人）

examples.en: He is Congolese and speaks French at work.
examples.zh: 他是刚果人，在工作中说法语。

examples.en: Many Congolese live in Kinshasa, one of Africa’s largest cities.
examples.zh: 许多刚果人居住在金沙萨，这是非洲最大的城市之一。

extraExplanation: “Congolese”容易引起混淆，因为世界上有两个国家名称都含“Congo”：刚果民主共和国（首都金沙萨，常简称 DRC）和刚果共和国（首都布拉柴维尔）。英语里“Congolese”可以指两者中的任意一方，具体要看上下文。
在需要更精确时，英语常说“DRC”/“the Democratic Republic of the Congo”或“the Republic of the Congo”，也会用“Congolese (DRC)”或“Congolese (Congo-Brazzaville)”来避免歧义。

summary.en: Congoleum is a trademark name for vinyl/linoleum-style floor covering, sometimes used casually to mean that type of flooring.
summary.zh: Congoleum 是一种乙烯基/油毡类地板的商标名，口语中有时也泛指这类地板。

definition.en: a brand name for resilient floor covering (especially sheet vinyl or linoleum), sometimes used informally to mean this kind of flooring in general.
definition.zh: （商标）一种弹性地板材料的品牌名（尤指卷材乙烯基地板或油毡）；在口语中有时也被用来泛指这类地板。

examples.en: The kitchen floor is covered with Congoleum, so it’s easy to wipe clean.
examples.zh: 厨房地面铺的是 Congoleum，所以很容易擦干净。

examples.en: In older apartments, you might see Congoleum laid over the original wood floor.
examples.zh: 在一些老公寓里，你可能会看到在原木地板上面又铺了一层 Congoleum。

extraExplanation: “Congoleum”最早是美国一家地板材料公司的商标名，常见于20世纪的住宅装修语境。后来在某些地区，它会像“Xerox/复印机”那样，被人用来泛指某类地板材料，但在正式写作里最好把它当作品牌名（首字母大写），或改用更通用的说法：vinyl flooring / linoleum / sheet flooring。

summary.en: Congoleum is a brand name often used to mean a linoleum- or vinyl-like floor covering.
summary.zh: Congoleum 是一个品牌名，常被用来泛指类似油毡或乙烯基地板的地面铺材。

definition.en: (Trademark) a type of durable floor covering, similar to linoleum or vinyl flooring, often sold in sheets or tiles.
definition.zh: （商标名）一种耐用的地板铺材，类似油毡或乙烯基地板，常以卷材或地板砖形式出售。

examples.en: They covered the kitchen floor with Congoleum because it was easy to clean.
examples.zh: 他们用 Congoleum 铺了厨房地面，因为很容易清洁。

examples.en: Old apartments sometimes have Congoleum in the hallway instead of wood.
examples.zh: 老公寓的走廊有时铺的是 Congoleum，而不是木地板。

extraExplanation: “Congoleum”最初是美国公司/品牌名，常被当作普通名词用来指“类似油毡（linoleum）的地板材料”。在日常英语里，它通常出现在家装、房屋租赁、维修等语境。
在书面写作中，如果不是特指品牌，常用更通用的说法：“linoleum”（油毡）或“vinyl flooring”（乙烯基地板）。

summary.en: Congonhas is a proper name in Brazil: a city in Minas Gerais, and commonly the name people use for São Paulo–Congonhas Airport.
summary.zh: Congonhas 是巴西的专有名词：既可指米纳斯吉拉斯州的一座城市，也常用来指圣保罗孔戈尼亚斯机场。

definition.en: A municipality (city) in the state of Minas Gerais, Brazil, known historically for gold mining and for the Baroque sanctuary and sculptures by Aleijadinho.
definition.zh: 巴西米纳斯吉拉斯州的一座城市（市镇），历史上以淘金/矿业以及巴洛克风格的圣地与雕塑（如阿莱雅迪尼奥的作品）而闻名。

examples.en: Many travelers visit Congonhas to see the Sanctuary of Bom Jesus de Matosinhos.
examples.zh: 许多游客去孔戈尼亚斯（Congonhas）参观博姆热苏斯·德·马托辛纽斯圣地。

examples.en: Congonhas is in Minas Gerais, a region famous for colonial-era art and architecture.
examples.zh: 孔戈尼亚斯位于米纳斯吉拉斯州，该地区以殖民时期的艺术与建筑闻名。

definition.en: (Commonly) Short for São Paulo–Congonhas Airport, a major domestic airport in São Paulo, Brazil.
definition.zh: （常用）指圣保罗孔戈尼亚斯机场（São Paulo–Congonhas Airport），巴西圣保罗市的重要国内航线机场。

examples.en: My flight to Rio departs from Congonhas, not Guarulhos.
examples.zh: 我去里约的航班从孔戈尼亚斯机场起飞，不是从瓜鲁柳斯机场。

examples.en: Congonhas is popular for quick business trips within Brazil.
examples.zh: 孔戈尼亚斯机场很适合巴西国内的短途商务出行。

extraExplanation: “Congonhas”在英语里通常作为专有名词使用：要么指米纳斯吉拉斯州的城市，要么在旅行语境中指圣保罗的孔戈尼亚斯机场。读到句子时可以靠上下文判断：出现“flight/airport/terminal”等词，多半是机场；出现“Minas Gerais/sanctuary/baroque”等词，多半是城市。

summary.en: “Congoni” isn’t a common English word; it’s likely a name or a misspelling.
summary.zh: “congoni”不是常见英语词，可能是专有名词或拼写错误。

definition.en: Not a standard English word. “Congoni” is most likely (1) a proper name (e.g., a surname/place name), or (2) a misspelling of another word.
definition.zh: 不是标准英语词。“congoni”更可能是（1）专有名词（如姓氏/地名），或（2）其他单词的拼写错误。

examples.en: I couldn’t find “congoni” in major English dictionaries—do you mean a name or another word?
examples.zh: 我在主要英语词典里找不到“congoni”——你是指名字还是想拼另一个词？

examples.en: Could you share the sentence where you saw “congoni”? That will help identify it.
examples.zh: 你能把你看到“congoni”的句子发一下吗？这样更容易判断。

extraExplanation:
如果你想查的是类似拼写的英文词，常见的可能是：
- Congo（刚果）
- conga（康加鼓；康加舞）
- congenial（令人愉快的；性格相投的）
把你原句或截图发来，我可以帮你精确判断是哪一个，并给出正确释义与用法。

summary.en: “Congos” usually means the two countries called Congo, or multiple things named Congo.
summary.zh: “Congos”通常指“两个刚果”（同名的两个国家），也可泛指多个名为 Congo 的事物。

definition.en: Plural of Congo; often used to refer to the two countries in Central Africa that share the name Congo (the Republic of the Congo and the Democratic Republic of the Congo).
definition.zh: Congo 的复数；常用来指中非同名的两个国家：刚果共和国（布拉柴维尔）与刚果民主共和国（金沙萨）。

examples.en: News reports sometimes talk about “the Congos” to compare the two neighboring countries.
examples.zh: 新闻报道有时会用“the Congos（两个刚果）”来比较这两个相邻国家。

examples.en: Trade between the Congos has been affected by border policies.
examples.zh: 两个刚果之间的贸易会受到边境政策影响。

definition.en: Plural of Congo; can also mean multiple things named “Congo,” such as the Congo River or places/organizations with that name.
definition.zh: Congo 的复数；也可指多个名为“Congo”的事物，例如刚果河，或带有“Congo”名称的地名/机构等。

examples.en: The map labels different Congos, including the Congo River and the two countries.
examples.zh: 这张地图标注了不同的“Congo”，包括刚果河以及两个国家。

synonyms: DRC and the Republic of the Congo
extraExplanation:
“the Congos”这种说法最常见的语境是区分两个国家：
1) the Republic of the Congo（刚果共和国，首都 Brazzaville 布拉柴维尔）
2) the Democratic Republic of the Congo（刚果民主共和国，常简称 DRC，首都 Kinshasa 金沙萨）。
因为两国首都隔着刚果河相望，所以也常被叫作“Congo-Brazzaville”和“Congo-Kinshasa”。
注意不要和 conga（康加鼓/康加舞）混淆：发音和拼写接近，但意思完全不同。

summary.en: “Congou” is not a standard English word; you probably mean “Congo,” the Congo River or either of the two Central African countries.
summary.zh: “congou”不是标准英语词；你可能想写“Congo”，指刚果河或中非两个名为刚果的国家之一。

definition.en: (Likely intended) Congo: a name used for the Congo River and for two countries in Central Africa (the Republic of the Congo and the Democratic Republic of the Congo).
definition.zh: （很可能是想写）Congo：可指刚果河，也可指中非的两个国家名称（刚果共和国与刚果民主共和国）。

examples.en: The Congo River is one of the deepest rivers in the world.
examples.zh: 刚果河是世界上最深的河流之一。

examples.en: She traveled to the Democratic Republic of the Congo for a research project.
examples.zh: 她因研究项目前往刚果民主共和国。

examples.en: Brazzaville is the capital of the Republic of the Congo.
examples.zh: 布拉柴维尔是刚果共和国的首都。

extraExplanation: “congou”在英语里不是常见拼写；更常见的是“Congo”。如果你想查的是别的词（例如人名、品牌名、游戏名或网络用语），可以告诉我它出现的句子或语境，我可以更准确地解释。
注意区分两个国家：Republic of the Congo（刚果共和国，首都Brazzaville）与Democratic Republic of the Congo（刚果民主共和国，常简称DRC，首都Kinshasa）。在新闻与历史语境中，DRC过去也常被称为“Zaire（扎伊尔）”。

summary.en: Congruous means “matching/appropriate,” and in math it can mean “identical in shape and size.”
summary.zh: congruous 表示“协调一致/合适”；在数学中还可表示“全等（形状和大小相同）”。

definition.en: (of something) suitable, matching, or consistent with something else; not awkward or out of place.
definition.zh: （事物）适合的；协调一致的；与……相符的；不突兀的。

examples.en: His calm tone was congruous with the serious situation.
examples.zh: 他冷静的语气与严肃的局势很相符。

examples.en: The modern furniture looks congruous in this bright, open room.
examples.zh: 这套现代家具放在这个明亮通透的房间里很协调。

definition.en: (in geometry, of figures) exactly the same in shape and size.
definition.zh: （几何）全等的（形状和大小完全相同）。

examples.en: The two triangles are congruous, so their corresponding sides are equal.
examples.zh: 这两个三角形是全等的，所以对应边相等。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“congous”不是常见英语单词；最可能是拼写成 **congruous**（少了字母 r 和 u 的位置不对）。
词源来自拉丁语 *congruus*，意为“相配的、合适的”。在日常英语里常与介词 **with** 连用：**be congruous with**（与……一致/相符）。

summary.en: “Congrats” is an informal way to say “congratulations.”
summary.zh: “congrats”是“congratulations（恭喜）”的非正式说法。

definition.en: A casual way to say “congratulations,” used to express praise or happiness for someone’s achievement or good news.
definition.zh: “congratulations”的非正式说法，用来表达对他人成就或好消息的祝贺、称赞。

examples.en: Congrats on your new job!
examples.zh: 恭喜你找到新工作！

examples.en: Congrats—you did a great presentation.
examples.zh: 恭喜你——你的展示做得很棒。

examples.en: Congrats! I’m really happy for you.
examples.zh: 恭喜！我真替你开心。

extraExplanation: “congrats”是“congratulations”的口语缩写，常见于聊天、短信、社交媒体和轻松场合。正式场合（例如邮件给上级、正式贺信）更推荐用“Congratulations on …”。
语气提示：对朋友或同龄人说“Congrats!”很自然；对长辈或正式对象可以用更完整、更礼貌的表达，如“Congratulations on your promotion.”

summary.en: “Congratulable” means “deserving congratulations.” It’s correct but uncommon; speakers often choose “commendable” or “congratulatory.”
summary.zh: “congratulable”意为“值得祝贺的”。这个词正确但较少用，日常更常见“commendable（值得称赞的）”或“congratulatory（表示祝贺的）”。

definition.en: Deserving praise or congratulations; worth congratulating.
definition.zh: 值得称赞或祝贺的；可被祝贺的。

examples.en: Finishing your first marathon is a congratulable achievement.
examples.zh: 完成你的第一次马拉松是一项值得祝贺的成就。

examples.en: Her promotion is congratulable, but she stayed humble.
examples.zh: 她的晋升值得祝贺，但她依然很谦逊。

extraExplanation: “congratulable”在现代英语中比较少见，日常表达更常用“congratulations on …”“congratulatory”（表示祝贺的）或“praiseworthy / commendable”（值得称赞的）。
构词上：congratulate（祝贺）+ -able（“可以……的 / 值得……的”），字面意思就是“值得被祝贺的”。

summary.en: “Congratulant” means “expressing congratulations” (adj.) or “a person who offers congratulations” (n.), but it is relatively uncommon in modern English.
summary.zh: “congratulant”可作形容词表示“祝贺的”，也可作名词表示“祝贺者”，但在现代英语中较少见。

definition.en: expressing congratulations; offering praise for someone’s success or good news.
definition.zh: 表示祝贺的；向他人的成功或喜讯致贺的。

examples.en: She sent a congratulant message after hearing about his promotion.
examples.zh: 听说他升职后，她发了一条表示祝贺的信息。

examples.en: The coach gave a short but congratulant speech to the team.
examples.zh: 教练给队员们做了一个简短但充满祝贺的讲话。

definition.en: a person who congratulates someone.
definition.zh: 祝贺者；向别人道贺的人。

examples.en: Several congratulants gathered outside the office to greet the new director.
examples.zh: 几位祝贺者聚集在办公室外迎接新主任。

extraExplanation: “congratulant”在现代英语里比较少见，更常用的是形容词“congratulatory”（祝贺的）或名词“congratulator”（祝贺的人）。在正式写作中，用“congratulatory message/letter/speech”会更自然。

summary.en: “Congratulate” means to express happiness and praise to someone for good news or success.
summary.zh: “Congratulate”表示因某人的好消息或成功而向其表达高兴与称赞，即“祝贺”。

definition.en: to tell someone you are happy about their success, achievement, or good news; to praise them warmly
definition.zh: 祝贺；向某人表示祝贺（对其成功、成就或喜事表示高兴并称赞）

examples.en: I congratulated her on passing the exam.
examples.zh: 我祝贺她通过了考试。

examples.en: They congratulated him for winning first place.
examples.zh: 他们祝贺他获得第一名。

examples.en: Please congratulate your team—everyone worked hard.
examples.zh: 请祝贺你的团队——大家都很努力。

definition.en: (reflexive) to feel pleased with yourself about something you did
definition.zh: （反身用法）为自己做成某事而感到得意/自喜

examples.en: He congratulated himself on making a smart decision.
examples.zh: 他为自己做了一个明智的决定而暗自得意。

examples.en: Don’t congratulate yourself too soon—the work isn’t finished.
examples.zh: 别高兴得太早——工作还没完成。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“congratulat”通常是拼写未完成或少了结尾的形式；正确拼写是 **congratulate**。
常见搭配：**congratulate someone on something**（更常用）或 **congratulate someone for something**（也可以，但频率稍低）。注意不要说 *congratulate to someone*。

summary.en: “Congratulate” means to express happiness and praise to someone for a success or good news, often with “congratulate someone on something.”
summary.zh: “Congratulate”表示向某人道贺、称赞对方的成功或好消息，常用结构是“congratulate someone on something”。

definition.en: to tell someone you are happy about their success or good news; to praise them and say “well done.”
definition.zh: 向某人表示祝贺；为对方的成功或好消息感到高兴并称赞（如说“做得好”）。

examples.en: I congratulated her on getting the job.
examples.zh: 我祝贺她找到了这份工作。

examples.en: They congratulated us for winning the match.
examples.zh: 他们祝贺我们赢得了比赛。

examples.en: Please congratulate him on his graduation.
examples.zh: 请祝贺他毕业。

definition.en: to feel pleased or proud about something you have achieved (often used as “congratulate yourself”).
definition.zh: 为自己的成就感到满意/自豪（常用作“congratulate yourself”）。

examples.en: She congratulated herself on staying calm during the interview.
examples.zh: 她为自己在面试中保持冷静而感到自豪。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：congratulate someone on something（更常用：祝贺某人某事）；congratulate someone for something（也可用，但在现代英语里通常不如 on 常见）。
易混词：celebrate（庆祝活动本身）vs. congratulate（对“人”表示祝贺）。例如：We celebrated the victory. / We congratulated the team.
语气与文化：英语里对他人成功说“Congratulations!”很自然；正式一点可说“Congratulations on your promotion.”，更亲近可说“Congrats!”。

summary.en: “Congratulated” is the past form of “congratulate,” meaning you told someone you were pleased about their success or good news.
summary.zh: “congratulated”是“congratulate”的过去式/过去分词，表示你因对方的成功或好消息而向其表示祝贺。

definition.en: to tell someone you are happy about their success or a special event (past tense or past participle of “congratulate”)
definition.zh: 向某人表示祝贺、为对方的成功或喜事感到高兴（congratulate 的过去式/过去分词）

examples.en: She congratulated him on passing the exam.
examples.zh: 她祝贺他通过了考试。

examples.en: We congratulated our friend on her new job.
examples.zh: 我们祝贺朋友找到了新工作。

examples.en: He was congratulated by his teammates after the match.
examples.zh: 比赛后，他受到了队友们的祝贺。

definition.en: to formally praise or express approval to someone for an achievement (often in public or official situations)
definition.zh: （常用于正式或公开场合）对某人的成就表示赞扬或祝贺

examples.en: The principal congratulated the students for their hard work.
examples.zh: 校长表扬并祝贺学生们的努力。

examples.en: She congratulated the team in her speech.
examples.zh: 她在演讲中向团队表示祝贺。

extraExplanation: “congratulated”常与介词 on 连用：congratulated + 人 + on + 事情（成就/喜事）。例如：congratulated me on my promotion。
注意区分：congratulate（祝贺某人）≠ celebrate（庆祝某事）。常见表达：Congratulations!（恭喜！）是名词复数形式的固定用法。

summary.en: “Congratulates” means “says congratulations to someone” (he/she/it form of congratulate).
summary.zh: “congratulates”表示“向某人表示祝贺”，是 congratulate 的第三人称单数形式。

definition.en: (Third-person singular of “congratulate”) to tell someone you are pleased about their success, good news, or special event.
definition.zh: （动词 congratulate 的第三人称单数）向某人表示祝贺，因其成功、好消息或重要事件而表达喜悦。

examples.en: She congratulates him on passing the exam.
examples.zh: 她祝贺他通过了考试。

examples.en: The manager congratulates the team for finishing the project early.
examples.zh: 经理祝贺团队提前完成了项目。

examples.en: He congratulates his sister on her new job.
examples.zh: 他祝贺妹妹找到新工作。

extraExplanation: “congratulates”用于一般现在时，主语是第三人称单数（he/she/it 或单数名词）时使用：He congratulates… / My dad congratulates…
常见搭配：congratulate someone on something（因某事祝贺某人）；也可见 congratulate someone for doing something（因做了某事而祝贺某人），但考试、获奖、结婚等更常用 on。
易混：celebrate 是“庆祝活动/庆贺某事”（celebrate a win / celebrate Christmas）；congratulate 是“对某人说祝贺”（congratulate a person）。

summary.en: “Congratulating” means expressing praise and happiness to someone for their success or good news.
summary.zh: “congratulating”表示为他人的成功或好消息表达祝贺与高兴。

definition.en: praising someone and expressing happiness about their success or good news (present participle/gerund form of “congratulate”)
definition.zh: 祝贺某人，表达对其成功或好消息的高兴（“congratulate”的现在分词/动名词形式）

examples.en: I’m congratulating you on your promotion.
examples.zh: 我正在祝贺你升职。

examples.en: She walked up to him, congratulating him on winning the race.
examples.zh: 她走向他，祝贺他赢得比赛。

examples.en: Congratulating others is a simple way to build good relationships.
examples.zh: 祝贺别人是建立良好关系的一个简单方式。

extraExplanation: “congratulating”常见搭配：congratulate + 人 + on + 事情（congratulate you on your new job）。注意不要说“congratulate for”。
语气区别：congratulate（祝贺具体成就/好消息） vs. praise/compliment（称赞能力或外表）。例如：Congratulations on your graduation!（祝贺毕业）/ You look great today.（夸你今天很好看）
日常口语里更常直接说“Congratulations!”；写邮件/正式场合可用：Congratulations on… / Please accept my congratulations on…

summary.en: Congratulation means an expression of happiness and praise for someone’s success; in everyday English, people usually say “congratulations” (plural).
summary.zh: congratulation 指对他人成功或喜讯的祝贺；日常英语更常用复数 congratulations 作为固定祝贺用语。

definition.en: an expression of praise and happiness for someone’s good news or success
definition.zh: （对他人喜讯或成功的）祝贺；恭喜的话

examples.en: Please accept my congratulations on your new job.
examples.zh: 请接受我对你新工作的祝贺。

examples.en: He sent a message of congratulations after she won the award.
examples.zh: 她获奖后，他发来一条祝贺信息。

extraExplanation: 日常英语里更常用复数形式 “congratulations”（作为固定祝贺用语），比如：Congratulations! / Congratulations on your graduation. 单数 “a congratulation” 比较少见，通常出现在更正式、强调“一次祝贺表达/一封贺信”的语境中。
常见搭配：congratulations on + 名词/动名词（on your promotion / on winning）。

summary.en: Congratulational means ‘expressing congratulations,’ but it is uncommon; congratulatory is more natural.
summary.zh: congratulational 意为“表示祝贺的”，但很少用；更常见、更地道的是 congratulatory。

definition.en: Relating to or expressing congratulations; used to congratulate someone.
definition.zh: 与祝贺有关的；表示祝贺的；用于向他人道贺的。

examples.en: She sent him a congratulational message after he got the job.
examples.zh: 他拿到那份工作后，她给他发了一条祝贺的信息。

examples.en: The mayor gave a congratulational speech to the graduating students.
examples.zh: 市长向毕业生发表了一段祝贺致辞。

extraExplanation: “congratulational”在现代英语中非常少见，写作和正式场合更常用“congratulatory”。比如更自然的搭配是“a congratulatory message/speech/note”。
词形来源上，它由“congratulation（祝贺）+ -al（形容词后缀）”构成；但实际使用频率低，所以母语者看到时可能觉得生硬或不地道。

summary.en: “Congratulations” is a common phrase to celebrate someone’s success or happy news.
summary.zh: “Congratulations”是英语里最常用的祝贺用语，用来庆祝他人的成功或喜事。

definition.en: An expression used to tell someone you are happy about their success or good news.
definition.zh: 用于向别人表达你为他们的成功或好消息感到高兴的祝贺用语。

examples.en: Congratulations on your new job!
examples.zh: 恭喜你找到新工作！

examples.en: Congratulations! You did it.
examples.zh: 恭喜！你做到了。

examples.en: Congratulations on graduating from college.
examples.zh: 恭喜你大学毕业。

extraExplanation: “Congratulations”在英语里非常常见，既可以单独说“Congratulations!”（语气更兴奋、直接），也常用“Congratulations on + 名词/动名词”来说明祝贺的具体事情，如“on passing the exam / on your promotion”。
在更正式的场合（邮件、贺卡）里也可以写："Congratulations on your achievement." 或 "Please accept my congratulations."

summary.en: A congratulator is a person who congratulates someone.
summary.zh: congratulator 指“祝贺者”，即向别人表示祝贺的人。

definition.en: a person who congratulates someone; someone who expresses praise or good wishes for another person’s success or happy event
definition.zh: 祝贺者；向他人的成功或喜事表示祝贺、称赞或致意的人

examples.en: After the award ceremony, she was surrounded by congratulators.
examples.zh: 颁奖典礼结束后，许多人围着她向她道贺。

examples.en: He is a warm, sincere congratulator who always celebrates other people’s wins.
examples.zh: 他是个热情真诚的祝贺者，总会为别人的胜利而高兴。

extraExplanation: “congratulator”在现代英语中不算常用，更自然的说法通常是“someone who congratulated me/him/her”或“well-wisher（祝福者）”。在正式或文学语境里偶尔会看到，用来强调“来祝贺的人群”。
词形来源：congratulate（祝贺）+ -or（表示“做某事的人”）。类似构词：creator（创造者）、educator（教育者）。

summary.en: “Congratulatorily” means “in a way that expresses congratulations.”
summary.zh: “congratulatorily”表示“以祝贺的方式；表示祝贺地”。

definition.en: In a way that expresses congratulations or praise for someone’s success or good news.
definition.zh: 以祝贺的方式；表示对他人成功或喜讯的祝贺与赞扬。

examples.en: She smiled congratulatorily and shook his hand after the performance.
examples.zh: 演出结束后，她带着祝贺的微笑与他握手。

examples.en: The coach spoke congratulatorily to the team for their hard work.
examples.zh: 教练用祝贺的语气表扬球队的努力。

examples.en: He nodded congratulatorily when he heard she got the job.
examples.zh: 听说她拿到工作后，他点头表示祝贺。

extraExplanation: “congratulatorily”是由形容词/动词相关形式“congratulatory / congratulate”加上副词后缀“-ly”构成，表示“以……的方式”。在日常口语里更常用的是直接说“congratulations!”或用短语“in a congratulatory way / tone”。
常见搭配：smile/speak/nod congratulatorily（祝贺地微笑/说话/点头）；look at someone congratulatorily（用祝贺的眼神看着某人）。

summary.en: “Congratulatory” means expressing congratulations or praise for someone’s success or happy news.
summary.zh: “congratulatory” 意为“表示祝贺的”，用于祝贺他人的成功或喜事。

definition.en: Expressing praise and good wishes because someone has achieved something or reached a happy event.
definition.zh: 表示祝贺的；因某人取得成就或遇到喜事而表达称赞与祝福的。

examples.en: She sent a congratulatory message after he got the job.
examples.zh: 他找到工作后，她发来了一条祝贺信息。

examples.en: The mayor gave a congratulatory speech to the winning team.
examples.zh: 市长向获胜的队伍发表了祝贺致辞。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：congratulatory message/speech/letter/remarks（祝贺信息/演讲/信/讲话）。
语气提示：congratulatory 通常比较正式，日常更常说 Congratulations! 或 I’m happy for you.
相关词：congratulate（v. 祝贺），congratulations（n. 祝贺的话，常用复数）。

summary.en: “Congredient” means “agreeing or consistent,” but it is rare; “congruent” or “consistent” is more common today.
summary.zh: “congredient”意为“一致的/相符的”，但很少用；现代英语更常见“congruent”或“consistent”。

definition.en: agreeing; consistent or compatible with something else (often used in formal or older writing).
definition.zh: 一致的；相符的；与……相容的（多用于正式或较旧的书面语）。

examples.en: His actions were not congredient with his promises.
examples.zh: 他的行为与他的承诺并不一致。

examples.en: The results are congredient with earlier studies.
examples.zh: 这些结果与先前的研究相符。

extraExplanation: “congredient”较少见，现代英语更常用近义词“congruent /ˈkɑŋɡruənt/”或“consistent/compatible”。在学术写作中表达“与……一致/相符”，常用搭配是“consistent with / in line with”。
词源上与拉丁语“con-（一起）+ gradi（行走/步伐）”相关，核心意象是“步调一致”，因此引申为“相符、协调”。

summary.en: “Congree” is usually a nonstandard spelling for “agree” (or sometimes “concur/match”). Use “agree” in normal writing.
summary.zh: “congree”通常是“agree”的非标准拼写（有时也被用来表示“相符/一致”）。正常写作建议用“agree”。

definition.en: (Nonstandard; often a misspelling) to agree; to have the same opinion as someone.
definition.zh: （非标准用法；常见拼写错误）同意；与某人观点一致。

examples.en: I congree with you. (Better: I agree with you.)
examples.zh: 我 congree 你。（更好：I agree with you.）

examples.en: Do you congree that we should leave now? (Better: Do you agree…?)
examples.zh: 你 congree 我们现在该走吗？（更好：Do you agree…?）

definition.en: (Rare/archaic) to be in harmony or correspond; to match.
definition.zh: （罕见/古旧）一致；相符；相协调。

examples.en: His actions did not congree with his words. (More common today: did not match / did not agree with)
examples.zh: 他的行为与他的言辞不相符。（更常用：did not match / did not agree with）

extraExplanation:
“congree”在现代标准英语里很少见，写作中通常会被当作拼写错误。最常见的正确词是：
- **agree**（同意）：I agree with you.
- **concur**（更正式的“同意”）：I concur.
如果你想表达“相符/一致”，也常用：**match / correspond / be consistent with**。

summary.en: “Congreet” is a rare, old-fashioned verb meaning “to greet” or “to greet one another.”
summary.zh: “Congreet”是一个罕见的古语动词，意思是“问候（某人）”或“彼此问候”。

definition.en: (Rare/archaic) to greet or salute (someone), often meaning to greet warmly or to greet one another.
definition.zh: （罕见/古语）向（某人）致意、问候；也可指彼此相互问候。

examples.en: They congreeted each other at the gate before the ceremony began.
examples.zh: 仪式开始前，他们在门口彼此问候。

examples.en: The host congreeted the guests with a smile and a handshake.
examples.zh: 主人微笑着握手问候来宾。

extraExplanation: “congreet”在现代英语里几乎不使用，多见于较老的文学或宗教/正式文体中。学习时更实用的常用词是 greet（问候）或 welcome（欢迎）。
它容易被误读为 concrete（混凝土；具体的）或 congratulate（祝贺）。如果你本来想查的是其中一个词，也可以告诉我，我可以给你它们的详细词条和用法对比。

summary.en: Congegable means “able or suitable to gather together,” and more rarely “sociable.”
summary.zh: congregable 指“可聚集的、适合集合的”，较少见也可指“合群的”。

definition.en: able to gather into a group; suitable for meeting or assembling together
definition.zh: 可聚集的；适合聚会或集合的

examples.en: The garden is a congregable space where neighbors can meet and talk.
examples.zh: 这座花园是个可聚集的空间，邻居们可以在这里见面聊天。

examples.en: After the lecture, students looked for a congregable area to continue the discussion.
examples.zh: 讲座结束后，学生们寻找一个适合集合的地方继续讨论。

definition.en: (of a person) inclined to gather with others; sociable (rare)
definition.zh: （指人）爱与人相聚的；合群的（较少见）

examples.en: She’s naturally congregable, so she enjoys clubs and community events.
examples.zh: 她天生很合群，所以喜欢参加社团和社区活动。

extraExplanation: “congregable”在现代英语中比较少见，更多时候人们会用更常见的词来表达相同意思，比如描述“空间适合聚集”会说 *a good place to gather*，描述“人很合群”会说 *sociable* 或 *gregarious*。
词根来自拉丁语 *congregare*（集合到一起），其中 *con-* 表示“共同”，*grex/gregis* 表示“群、群体”（也见于 *gregarious*）。

summary.en: A Congregationalist is a Protestant who belongs to a church tradition where each local congregation governs itself.
summary.zh: Congregationalist 指公理会信徒；该新教传统强调地方教会（会众）自治。

definition.en: a member of the Congregational Church (Congregationalism), a Protestant tradition in which each local church governs itself independently
definition.zh: 公理会（Congregationalism）成员；一种新教传统，强调每个地方教会自治、独立治理

examples.en: Her grandparents were Congregationalists and attended a small church in New England.
examples.zh: 她的祖父母是公理会信徒，在新英格兰参加一间小教会的礼拜。

examples.en: Congregationalists often value local decision-making in church matters.
examples.zh: 公理会通常重视教会事务由地方自行决策。

extraExplanation: 你输入的拼写“congreganist”更常见的标准拼写是 **Congregationalist**。
公理会的核心特点是“**会众自治**”（congregational polity）：每个教会通常自行选立牧师、管理财务与事务，而不是由主教或中央机构统一管理。
在英美历史语境中，公理会常与早期新英格兰清教徒传统有关；阅读历史文本时常出现。

summary.en: A congregant is an individual member of a congregation, especially someone who attends a church regularly.
summary.zh: congregant 指会众中的个人成员，尤指经常参加教会礼拜的人。

definition.en: A person who regularly attends and is considered a member of a church or other place of worship.
definition.zh: （教堂或其他礼拜场所的）会众成员；经常参加礼拜的人。

examples.en: The pastor greeted each congregant after the Sunday service.
examples.zh: 周日礼拜结束后，牧师向每位会众成员问候。

examples.en: As a congregant, she volunteers with the church’s food pantry.
examples.zh: 作为会众成员，她在教会的食品救助站做志愿者。

examples.en: The congregants sat quietly during the prayer.
examples.zh: 祷告时，会众安静地坐着。

extraExplanation: “congregant”来自拉丁语词根，和“congregation（会众；教会团体）”同源。它强调“个体成员”，而“congregation”更常指“整个会众/团体”。
在英语里这个词最常用于基督教语境，但也可以泛指其他宗教礼拜场所的成员。日常口语中也可用更普通的说法：church member（教会成员）或 attendee（参加者）。

summary.en: Congregants are members of a religious congregation—people who attend worship services; sometimes it can mean any gathered group (less common).
summary.zh: congregants 指会众/信众（参加宗教礼拜的人）；较少情况下也可泛指聚集的人群。

definition.en: People who regularly attend and worship at a particular church, synagogue, mosque, or other religious community.
definition.zh: （某教堂/会堂/清真寺等）固定参加礼拜或宗教活动的会众、信众。

examples.en: The pastor greeted the congregants after the service.
examples.zh: 礼拜结束后，牧师向会众打招呼。

examples.en: Several congregants volunteered to serve meals to the community.
examples.zh: 几位会众自愿为社区提供餐食。

examples.en: The congregants sang together during the hymn.
examples.zh: 会众在圣歌时一起歌唱。

definition.en: More general: people who gather as an audience or group (less common than the religious meaning).
definition.zh: （较少用）泛指聚集在一起的一群人、听众。

examples.en: The speaker thanked the congregants for coming to the memorial.
examples.zh: 演讲者感谢前来参加追思会的人们。

examples.en: Congregants filled the hall before the talk began.
examples.zh: 讲座开始前，大厅里坐满了聚集而来的人。

extraExplanation: “congregants”来自动词“congregate”（聚集），常用于宗教语境，强调“某个固定会众/教会成员”，比“people”更正式、更有群体归属感。
易混词："congregation"是“会众（整体）/礼拜人群（集合名词）”，"congregants"是其中的“个体成员（复数）”。

summary.en: Congregate means “to gather together,” especially people forming a group in one place; it can also mean “to bring together.”
summary.zh: Congregate 指“聚集、集合”，多用于人群在某处聚在一起；也可指“使聚集、使集中”。

definition.en: to come together in a group, especially in a public place
definition.zh: （尤指在公共场所）聚集；集合

examples.en: Fans congregated outside the stadium before the game.
examples.zh: 比赛前，球迷们聚集在体育场外。

examples.en: People often congregate in the kitchen during parties.
examples.zh: 聚会时，人们常常在厨房里聚在一起。

definition.en: to bring people or things together into one place or group
definition.zh: 使聚集；把……集中到一起

examples.en: The event helped congregate local artists and small businesses.
examples.zh: 这场活动促成了本地艺术家和小商家聚到一起。

examples.en: The teacher congregated the students near the door for a quick headcount.
examples.zh: 老师把学生集中到门口，快速点名。

extraExplanation: 词源上与“教会会众”有关：congregate 来自拉丁语 con-（一起）+ greg-（群、群体），同源词包括 congregation（会众；聚会）和 gregarious（合群的）。因此它常用于描述“人群自然地聚在一起”的场景。
语体与搭配：congregate 比 meet/gather 更强调“多人在同一地点形成群体”的画面感，常见搭配有 congregate outside/around/near…（聚在……外/周围/附近）。
文学/正式语境中也常见：如“congregate in the square（聚集在广场）”用来描写人群汇集的场面，带一点叙述性或较正式的语气。

summary.en: “Congregated” means people or things came together (or were gathered) in one place.
summary.zh: “congregated”表示人或事物聚集、集合在同一处（也可作形容词表示“聚集的”）。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of “congregate”) to come together and form a group, especially in a public place.
definition.zh: （congregate 的过去式/过去分词）聚集；集合（尤指在公共场所成群地聚在一起）。

examples.en: People congregated outside the theater after the show.
examples.zh: 演出结束后，人们聚集在剧院外面。

examples.en: Students congregated in the hallway, waiting for the next class.
examples.zh: 学生们聚集在走廊里，等着下一节课。

examples.en: The birds congregated near the lake at dusk.
examples.zh: 黄昏时鸟群聚集在湖边。

definition.en: Gathered together in one place; grouped.
definition.zh: 聚集的；集结在一起的。

examples.en: A congregated crowd filled the square.
examples.zh: 聚集的人群挤满了广场。

examples.en: We spoke to the congregated members before the meeting started.
examples.zh: 会议开始前，我们和聚集到场的成员聊了聊。

extraExplanation: “congregate”来自拉丁语 con-（一起）+ greg-（群、群体，和 group / gregarious 同源），所以本义就是“成群地聚在一起”。
在语体上，“congregate”比“gather”更正式一些，常用于新闻、公告或描述人群在某处聚集的场景。

summary.en: “Congregates” means “comes together in a group,” and is the third-person singular form of “congregate.”
summary.zh: “congregates”表示“聚集、集合”，是动词“congregate”的第三人称单数形式。

definition.en: (third-person singular of “congregate”) to come together and form a group, often in a public place.
definition.zh: （动词“congregate”的第三人称单数）聚集；集合（常在公共场所）

examples.en: After school, students congregates—sorry, congregate—near the gate to chat.
examples.zh: 放学后，学生们常在校门口聚在一起聊天。

examples.en: In winter, birds congregate around areas with more food.
examples.zh: 冬天，鸟类会在食物更多的地方聚集。

definition.en: (less common) to bring people together into a group.
definition.zh: （较少见）使人群聚集；召集

examples.en: The organizer congregates volunteers at the main entrance before the event begins.
examples.zh: 活动开始前，组织者在主入口处召集志愿者。

extraExplanation: “congregates”是动词第三人称单数形式：he/she/it congregates。其他常见形式：congregate（原形/复数主语）、congregated（过去式/过去分词）、congregating（现在分词）。
常见搭配：congregate around/near/outside（在……周围/附近/外面聚集）。
词源与“congregation（会众；集会）”相关，在宗教语境里可指信徒聚集；日常英语中也很常用来表示人群在某处“聚在一起”。

summary.en: “Congregating” means people are gathering together in one place, often forming a crowd.
summary.zh: “congregating”指人们聚集到同一地点，常形成一群人或人群。

definition.en: (present participle of “congregate”) coming together and gathering in a group, often in a public place.
definition.zh: （congregate 的现在分词）聚集在一起；集合成群，常指在公共场所聚拢。

examples.en: People were congregating outside the station after the concert.
examples.zh: 演唱会结束后，人们在车站外聚集。

examples.en: Students kept congregating in the hallway, so the teacher asked them to move along.
examples.zh: 学生们一直在走廊里聚集，老师就让他们往前走。

definition.en: (less common) gathering together for a religious purpose, such as worship.
definition.zh: （较少见）为宗教目的（如礼拜）而聚集。

examples.en: Families were congregating for Sunday service.
examples.zh: 家家户户在为周日礼拜聚集。

extraExplanation: “congregate”源自拉丁语词根，和“congregation（会众/人群）”有关，因此它常带有“人群聚拢、集中到某处”的感觉，比“gather”更正式一些。
在公共安全或管理语境里常见：例如标识里会写“Do not congregate here（请勿在此聚集）”。

summary.en: *Congregatio* is a Latin noun meaning “a gathering/assembly,” and it is the origin of the English word “congregation.”
summary.zh: *Congregatio* 是拉丁语名词，意为“聚集、集会”，也是英语 “congregation（会众/集会）” 的词源。

definition.en: A Latin word meaning “a gathering/assembly; a group brought together,” especially used in older church or scholarly writing as the source of the English word “congregation.”
definition.zh: 拉丁语词，意为“聚集、集会；聚在一起的一群人”，常见于较早的教会或学术语境中，也是英语 congregation（会众/集会）的词源。

examples.en: In medieval texts, *congregatio* can refer to a community of believers.
examples.zh: 在中世纪文献中，*congregatio* 可指信徒的团体（会众/社群）。

examples.en: The English word “congregation” comes from Latin *congregatio*.
examples.zh: 英语 “congregation” 源自拉丁语 *congregatio*。

extraExplanation: 从构词上看，*con-* 表示“共同、一起”，*greg-* 与“群、群体”（如英语 *gregarious* 合群的）有关；因此 *congregatio* 的核心意思就是“聚成一群”。
现代英语里更常用的对应词是 **congregation**（常指教堂里的会众，或泛指聚集的人群）。如果你是在查英文单词，通常建议用拼写 **congregation**。

summary.en: A congregation is a group of people gathered together, most commonly for religious worship.
summary.zh: congregation 指聚集在一起的一群人，最常指宗教礼拜中的会众。

definition.en: A group of people gathered together, especially for a religious service (such as in a church, synagogue, or mosque).
definition.zh: （尤指宗教礼拜时聚集的）会众；会堂/教堂里的信众

examples.en: The congregation stood and sang together.
examples.zh: 会众起立一起唱诗。

examples.en: After the service, the pastor greeted members of the congregation.
examples.zh: 礼拜结束后，牧师向会众致意。

definition.en: The act of gathering together; an assembly of people for a particular purpose.
definition.zh: 聚集；集会（为某种目的而集合的人群或行为）

examples.en: A congregation of reporters waited outside the courthouse.
examples.zh: 一群记者聚集在法院外等候。

examples.en: Large congregations are not allowed in this area after midnight.
examples.zh: 午夜后此区域不允许大规模聚集。

extraExplanation: “congregation”常与宗教语境强关联，最常见搭配包括：the congregation（会众整体）、members of the congregation（会众成员）、address the congregation（对会众讲话）。
词源来自拉丁语“congregare”（聚在一起），其中“grex/ gregis”有“羊群、群体”的意思，因此带有“聚成一群”的意象。英语里也有相关词如“gregarious”（合群的）。
文化上，“congregation”在不同宗教中都可用：教堂的会众、犹太会堂的会众、清真寺礼拜者等；用在非宗教场合时，语气通常比“crowd”更正式。

summary.en: Congregational means “related to a congregation (group of worshippers)” or, with a capital C, “related to the Congregational (Congregationalist) Protestant tradition.”
summary.zh: congregational 表示“与会众（礼拜聚会的人群）有关的”；首字母大写时可指“与公理宗/公理会这一新教传统有关的”。

definition.en: Related to a congregation (a group of people gathered for religious worship), especially in a church setting.
definition.zh: 与（宗教）会众/会众集体有关的；尤指与教堂礼拜中的会众有关的。

examples.en: Congregational singing is an important part of many church services.
examples.zh: 会众合唱是许多教会礼拜中的重要环节。

examples.en: The pastor spoke directly to the congregational audience.
examples.zh: 牧师直接对会众听众讲话。

definition.en: Related to Congregationalism, a Protestant tradition in which each local church governs itself independently.
definition.zh: 与公理宗（Congregationalism，一种强调地方教会自治的新教传统）有关的。

examples.en: She grew up in a Congregational church in New England.
examples.zh: 她在新英格兰的公理宗教会中长大。

examples.en: Congregational polity emphasizes local decision-making.
examples.zh: 公理宗的教会治理强调地方自治与本地决策。

extraExplanation: “congregational”来自“congregation”（会众、聚会的人群）。日常语境里常见搭配有：congregational singing（会众合唱）、congregational prayer（会众祷告）、congregational meeting（会众/教会成员大会）。
注意大小写：小写 congregational 通常表示“一般意义上的会众的”；大写 Congregational 常用于特指与“公理宗/公理会”相关的宗派或教会。

summary.en: A Protestant tradition where each local church is self-governing.
summary.zh: 一种强调地方教会（会众）自治的新教教会传统。

definition.en: A Protestant Christian church tradition in which each local congregation governs itself independently, rather than being controlled by bishops or a central church authority.
definition.zh: （新教）公理宗：一种教会传统，强调每个地方教会（会众）独立自治，不受主教制度或中央教会权威统一管辖。

examples.en: Congregationalism teaches that each congregation can choose its own pastor.
examples.zh: 公理宗主张每个会众可以自行选聘牧师。

examples.en: In Congregationalism, major decisions are often made by a vote of the members.
examples.zh: 在公理宗中，重大决定通常由会友投票表决。

extraExplanation: 公理宗（Congregationalism）在英语世界常与英格兰清教徒传统有关，强调“会众之约”（covenant community）与信徒共同参与治理。它对北美早期新英格兰地区（New England）的宗教与社会组织影响很大。
词形提示：congregation（会众、教堂会友）+ -al（形容词后缀）+ -ism（主义/体系）→ 表示“以会众为核心的教会制度/思想”。
相关对比：它常被拿来与 episcopacy（主教制）与 presbyterianism（长老制）对比：主教制由主教层级管理；长老制由长老会议等代表性机构治理；公理宗更强调地方教会自治。

summary.en: Congregationalism is a church tradition where each local congregation governs itself, and it also refers to the beliefs and practices of Congregational churches.
summary.zh: Congregationalism 指公理宗制度：地方教会自治；也可指公理宗教会的相关信仰与实践。

definition.en: a Christian church system in which each local congregation governs itself independently, rather than being controlled by bishops or a central authority
definition.zh: 公理宗制度；一种基督教教会体制：每个地方教会（会众）自治，不受主教或中央机构直接统辖

examples.en: Congregationalism emphasizes the authority of the local church in making decisions.
examples.zh: 公理宗强调地方教会在作决定时的权威与自主。

examples.en: In Congregationalism, members often vote on key issues like hiring a pastor.
examples.zh: 在公理宗体制中，会友常常就重要事务投票，例如聘任牧师。

definition.en: the beliefs and practices associated with Congregational churches, especially in Britain and the United States
definition.zh: 公理宗的信仰与实践（尤指英国与美国的公理宗教会传统）

examples.en: Her family has a long history of Congregationalism in New England.
examples.zh: 她的家族在新英格兰地区有很长的公理宗传统。

examples.en: The lecture compared Congregationalism with Presbyterian and Episcopal traditions.
examples.zh: 那场讲座比较了公理宗与长老宗、圣公会传统。

extraExplanation: 公理宗（Congregationalism）在英语世界常与“地方教会自治”联系最紧密：每个教会通常自行决定信仰告白、礼拜方式、财务与领袖任命等，彼此之间可以有联盟或协会，但一般不具备强制性的上下级管辖。
历史上，它与16—17世纪英国的新教改革、以及清教徒（Puritans）移民北美有密切关联，特别影响了美国新英格兰地区的宗教与社会生活。
相关对比：Episcopal/Anglican（主教制）强调主教体系；Presbyterian（长老制）强调由长老会等代表机构治理；Congregational（公理制）强调会众与地方教会的自主决策。

summary.en: A Congregationalist is a person (or describes a church) in a Christian tradition where local churches govern themselves.
summary.zh: Congregationalist 指公理会教徒（或公理会的），强调地方教会由会众自治、自行治理。

definition.en: a member of a Christian church tradition in which each local church is largely independent and governs itself
definition.zh: 公理会教徒；属于一种基督教传统的信徒，该传统强调每个地方教会基本独立并自行治理

examples.en: Her grandparents were Congregationalists in New England.
examples.zh: 她的祖父母是新英格兰的公理会教徒。

examples.en: Many Congregationalists emphasize local decision-making in church matters.
examples.zh: 许多公理会信徒强调教会事务由地方教会自行决定。

definition.en: relating to Congregationalism or to churches governed by their local congregation
definition.zh: 公理会的；与公理宗（或由地方会众自治的教会体制）有关的

examples.en: They attended a Congregationalist church on Sundays.
examples.zh: 他们周日去一所公理会教堂做礼拜。

examples.en: The school has Congregationalist roots.
examples.zh: 这所学校有公理会背景。

extraExplanation: “Congregationalist”与“Congregationalism（公理宗/公理会主义）”相关，核心观念是“会众自治”：每个地方教会（congregation）在信仰与治理上有较高自主权，而不是由主教或中央机构统一管理。
在美国文化语境中，这个词常与新英格兰早期殖民历史有关；许多早期清教徒社群发展出公理会传统，对当地教育与公共生活影响较大（例如一些早期学院与教会网络）。
现代用法中，它既可指具体宗派成员，也可更宽泛地指“以地方会众自治为治理特色的教会传统”。不同国家/地区的组织名称可能不同，需结合具体教会名称理解。

summary.en: A Congregationalist is a Protestant Christian whose church is governed locally by its own congregation.
summary.zh: Congregationalist 指公理会信徒：一种强调地方教会由本会众自治的新教传统。

definition.en: a member of a Protestant Christian church that is governed by each local congregation (church community) rather than by bishops or a central authority
definition.zh: 公理会（宗派）成员；一种新教传统，强调每个地方教会自治，而不是由主教或中央机构管理

examples.en: Her grandparents were Congregationalists in New England.
examples.zh: 她的祖父母在新英格兰是公理会信徒。

examples.en: The town’s Congregationalist church played a central role in community life.
examples.zh: 镇上的公理会教堂在社区生活中起着核心作用。

extraExplanation: “Congregationalist”与“congregational（会众治理的）”有关：核心理念是“地方教会自治”（local autonomy），重大事务由会众或长老在本地决定。
历史上，公理会在英格兰与北美殖民地（尤其新英格兰）影响很大；在美国语境中，它常与早期清教徒传统、地方社区教会和公民社会的发展联系在一起。
相关词：Congregationalism（公理制/公理会制度），congregation（会众；教会会众）。注意拼写：Congregationalist（人/成员），Congregational（形容词）。

summary.en: Congregationalists are people who belong to Congregational churches, which emphasize the independence of each local congregation.
summary.zh: Congregationalists 指公理宗（公理会）的信徒，强调各地方教会的自治独立。

definition.en: Members of Congregational churches—a Protestant Christian tradition in which each local church (congregation) governs itself rather than being controlled by bishops or a central authority.
definition.zh: 公理宗信徒；公理会成员——一种新教基督教传统，强调每个地方教会（会众）自治，而不是由主教或中央机构统一管辖。

examples.en: Many Congregationalists value local decision-making in church life.
examples.zh: 许多公理宗信徒重视教会生活中的地方自治与本地决策。

examples.en: In early New England, Congregationalists played a major role in community and education.
examples.zh: 在早期的新英格兰地区，公理宗信徒在社区治理与教育方面发挥了重要作用。

extraExplanation: “Congregationalists”常用于英美历史语境，尤其与17世纪英格兰的清教徒传统、以及北美新英格兰殖民地（如马萨诸塞）有关。
该传统的核心观念是“会众自治”（congregational polity）：每个地方教会在教义解释、牧师聘任、管理事务上拥有较大独立性。
在美国宗教史中，部分公理宗教会后来与其他教派合并发展，例如一些与归正宗或其他新教团体产生联合；因此在不同地区可能有不同组织名称。

summary.en: Congregationalize means to make a church or organization operate under congregational (local, member-led) governance, or to shift toward that system.
summary.zh: Congregationalize 指把教会/组织改为或转向“会众自治”的会众制（公理制）治理。

definition.en: to make something organized around, suited to, or governed by a congregation (a local church community), especially in the Congregationalist tradition
definition.zh: 使某事物按“会众制/公理制”（由当地会众自治）来组织、运作或管理；使之成为会众制的（尤指公理宗传统）

examples.en: Some reformers wanted to congregationalize the church so that each local group could choose its own leaders.
examples.zh: 一些改革者希望把教会改为会众制，这样每个地方团体都可以自行选出领袖。

examples.en: The proposal aimed to congregationalize decision-making rather than leave power with a central authority.
examples.zh: 该提案旨在让决策更会众化，而不是把权力留在中央权威手中。

definition.en: to adopt or shift toward congregational governance in a church or religious organization
definition.zh: （教会/宗教组织）实行或转向会众制治理

examples.en: Over time, the community congregationalized and began voting on major changes.
examples.zh: 随着时间推移，该团体转向会众制，并开始对重大变更进行投票表决。

extraExplanation: 这个词非常少见，多见于宗教史、教会治理或学术讨论中。它由“congregation（会众）”加动词后缀“-ize”构成，意思类似“使……化/使……采取某种制度”。日常英语里更常用的表达是“adopt congregational governance（采用会众制治理）”或“become Congregational（成为公理宗/会众制）”。

summary.en: “Congregationally” means “as a congregation; with the whole group participating,” especially in a worship setting.
summary.zh: “congregationally”意为“以会众（群体）共同参与的方式”，尤用于宗教礼拜场景。

definition.en: In a way that involves a congregation (a group of people gathered for worship or a community acting together).
definition.zh: 以会众（聚会敬拜的一群人）或群体共同参与的方式；以集体（会众）形式。

examples.en: The hymn was sung congregationally, with everyone joining in.
examples.zh: 这首赞美诗是以会众齐唱的方式唱的，大家都一起加入。

examples.en: They prayed congregationally at the end of the service.
examples.zh: 礼拜结束时，他们以会众共同祷告的方式祷告。

extraExplanation: “congregationally”多见于宗教语境，尤其描述“会众一起做某事”，如齐唱（congregational singing）、共同祷告等。
它也可与“Congregational”相关（指某些教会的组织传统/教会体制），但在日常用法里更常见的是泛指“以会众共同参与的方式”。

summary.en: A congregationer is a person who belongs to or attends a congregation, especially in a church.
summary.zh: congregationer 指会众成员，尤其是教会礼拜或宗教聚会的参加者。

definition.en: A member of a congregation; a person who regularly attends a particular church or religious assembly.
definition.zh: 会众成员；某个教会或宗教聚会的参加者（常指经常参加的人）。

examples.en: As a congregationer, she volunteers every Sunday after the service.
examples.zh: 作为会众的一员，她每个星期天礼拜后都会做志愿服务。

examples.en: The pastor thanked the congregationers for supporting the food drive.
examples.zh: 牧师感谢会众成员对食物募捐活动的支持。

extraExplanation: “congregationer”在现代英语中不太常见，更常用的说法是“member of the congregation”或“congregant”。在写作和新闻报道中，“congregant”更自然。

summary.en: A congregationer is a person who is part of a religious congregation and attends its services.
summary.zh: congregationer 指宗教会众，即参加礼拜/聚会的成员。

definition.en: A person who belongs to and regularly attends a church or other religious congregation; a member of a congregation.
definition.zh: （教会或宗教）会众；经常参加礼拜/聚会的信徒。

examples.en: The congregationer greeted the pastor after Sunday service.
examples.zh: 这位会众在周日礼拜后向牧师致意。

examples.en: As a new congregationer, she joined a small Bible study group.
examples.zh: 作为新来的会众，她加入了一个小型查经小组。

extraExplanation: “congregationer”在现代英语中不算常用；更常见的说法是“member of the congregation”或直接说“congregant”。但在一些宗教语境、较正式或较旧的用法中仍可见。

summary.en: A Congregationist is a member of a self-governing Protestant church tradition (Congregationalism), or something related to that tradition.
summary.zh: Congregationist 指公理宗（会众制）信徒，也可作形容词表示“与公理宗相关的”。

definition.en: a person who belongs to, supports, or follows Congregationalism (a Protestant Christian tradition in which each local church governs itself).
definition.zh: 公理宗（会众制）信徒；属于或支持公理宗的人（新教传统之一，强调每个地方教会自治）

examples.en: Her grandparents were Congregationists in New England.
examples.zh: 她的祖父母在新英格兰是公理宗信徒。

examples.en: The town’s early leaders were mostly Congregationists.
examples.zh: 这个小镇早期的领袖大多是公理宗人士。

definition.en: relating to Congregationalism or to Congregationist churches.
definition.zh: 与公理宗（会众制）有关的；公理宗教会的

examples.en: They attended a Congregationist service on Sunday.
examples.zh: 他们周日参加了公理宗的礼拜。

examples.en: The museum has records of Congregationist communities.
examples.zh: 博物馆保存着公理宗社群的档案记录。

extraExplanation: “Congregationist / Congregationalist”都常见：前者多指个人（信徒/成员），后者也常指传统或教会体系（Congregationalism）。日常使用中两者有时会互换，但写作时更推荐用“Congregationalism（公理宗传统）/ Congregational church（公理宗教会）”来表达制度或教会。
历史文化上，公理宗在英格兰清教徒运动中发展，并对北美殖民时期的新英格兰（如马萨诸塞）影响很大；强调地方教会由会众共同决定事务，而非由主教或中央教会层级统一管理。

summary.en: “Congregations” means groups/communities of people gathered together, most often for religious worship, but sometimes for any shared purpose.
summary.zh: “Congregations”指聚集在一起的人群/团体，最常指宗教礼拜的会众，也可泛指因共同目的而定期聚集的团体。

definition.en: groups of people gathered together, especially for religious worship (plural of "congregation")
definition.zh: 聚会的人群（尤指宗教礼拜的会众；“congregation”的复数）

examples.en: The church has two congregations: one meets in the morning and one in the evening.
examples.zh: 这座教堂有两个会众：一个上午聚会，一个晚上聚会。

examples.en: Different congregations organized food drives for families in need.
examples.zh: 不同的会众组织了食品募捐来帮助有需要的家庭。

definition.en: communities of people who regularly meet and share a common purpose (not necessarily religious)
definition.zh: 定期聚集、因共同目的而形成的团体（不一定是宗教团体）

examples.en: The city supports several congregations of artists and musicians.
examples.zh: 这座城市支持多个艺术家和音乐人的团体。

examples.en: Online congregations can form around hobbies like gaming or cooking.
examples.zh: 网络上也会围绕游戏或烹饪等爱好形成“社群/团体”。

extraExplanation: “congregation”在英语里最常见的语境是宗教：既可以指“会众”（参加礼拜的人），也可以指“一个地方教会/教会团体”（例如某个教堂的成员整体）。复数“congregations”常用于谈多个教会团体或多个聚会人群。
词根来自拉丁语，含义与“聚集到一起”有关；因此在非宗教语境中也可用来表示因共同兴趣或目标而形成的团体，但正式程度通常比“group/community”更高一点。

summary.en: Concerning or causing people/things to gather into a group (rare in modern use).
summary.zh: 表示与聚集有关或促使聚集（现代用法较少见）。

definition.en: tending to gather people or things into a group; relating to coming together as a crowd or assembly.
definition.zh: 倾向于把人或事物聚集在一起的；与聚集、集会有关的。

examples.en: Festivals have a congregative effect on small towns, bringing neighbors together.
examples.zh: 节日对小镇有一种“聚集效应”，把邻居们聚到一起。

examples.en: The new park became a congregative space where families met on weekends.
examples.zh: 新公园成了一个具有“聚集性”的空间，周末很多家庭会来相聚。

extraExplanation: “congregative”在现代英语中比较少见，更常用的是“congregating”（正在聚集的）或“congregational”（与教会会众/会众制度有关的）。
词根来自拉丁语 con-（一起）+ greg-（群、群体），同根词有：congregate（聚集）、gregarious（合群的）。

summary.en: Congregativeness means a tendency to gather with others or be social in groups.
summary.zh: Congregativeness 指“喜欢群聚、与他人结伴”的倾向或性质。
